title: The Coca-Cola Company Renews as Proud Partner of the TOUR Championship
summary: The Coca-Cola Company has renewed its sponsorship as a Proud Partner of the TOUR Championship through 2027 and signed a new five-year Official Marketing Partnership with the PGA TOUR, making it the Official Soft Drink of the PGA TOUR. This extended partnership highlights Coca-Cola's significant role in the tournament's charitable contributions, which include over $48 million raised to date and a record $5.5 million donation in 2022. Coca-Cola's involvement has also been crucial in initiatives like the TOUR Championship Charity Challenge, benefiting the East Lake Foundation and other charitable partners in Atlanta.

title: Ball and Coca-Cola join forces to trial carbon-cutting trucks in the UK
summary: Ball Beverage Packaging and Coca-Cola Europacific Partners (CCEP) are collaborating in the UK to trial hydrotreated vegetable oil (HVO) part-fueled trucks to reduce carbon emissions. This 12-month trial, supported by Menzies Distribution, aims to cut UK supply chain CO2e emissions by approximately 300 tons, with potential reductions of up to 90% if fully implemented. The initiative aligns with both companies' climate transition plans to achieve net-zero emissions and decarbonize their operations.

title: Distributing Economic Opportunity Across the U.S.
summary: This article highlights Sterling Kilpatrick's 26-year career at Coca-Cola UNITED, showcasing how the Coca-Cola system provides stability, opportunity, and economic impact across the U.S. It details Kilpatrick's journey from a temp worker to a machine operator, emphasizing the company's investment in its employees and communities. The piece also quantifies the Coca-Cola system's significant economic footprint, supporting 854,000 jobs and contributing $58 billion to the U.S. economy in 2022.

title: Coca‑Cola® Creations Drops Futuristic AI Experience at Las Vegas Sphere
summary: Coca-Cola Creations launched "Destination Y3000," a weeklong AI-powered experience at the Las Vegas Sphere, showcasing their Y3000 Zero Sugar flavor co-created with human and artificial intelligence. The event featured futuristic visuals on the Sphere's exosphere and a VIP experience with Marshmello and the Jonas Brothers, emphasizing the blend of technology and real-world interactions. This initiative concludes Coca-Cola Creations' second year of limited-edition drops, focusing on innovation and engaging fans through digital and physical activations.

title: Tax Court Upholds Coca-Cola Transfer Pricing Adjustment
summary: The Tax Court has upheld a transfer pricing adjustment against Coca-Cola relating to its Brazilian manufacturing affiliate. The court found that a Brazilian legal restriction capping royalties did not block the payment of arm's-length compensation via dividends, and that Coca-Cola failed to demonstrate which of its intangible assets were covered by a grandfather clause pre-dating the blocked income regulation. As a result, the court sustained the entire $882 million net transfer-pricing adjustment.

title: Ball raises its cup — and profile — with Kroenke Sports deal
summary: Ball Corp. has significantly boosted its profile and sustainability efforts through a wide-ranging marketing deal with Kroenke Sports & Entertainment, promoting its recyclable aluminum cups at major sports venues and events. The partnership has helped Ball showcase its commitment to environmental goals, including reducing emissions and increasing recycled content, while expanding production of its aluminum cups.

title: Fox Factory to buy baseball-softball brand Marucci for $572 million
summary: Fox Factory is acquiring Marucci Sports, a baseball and softball equipment brand, for $572 million, marking its first acquisition in a new sports category since 2015. This acquisition diversifies Fox's sales towards the consumer market while the company reported a significant 58% decline in sales within its bicycle division for the most recent quarter. The company-wide revenues were down 19% and net income down 30% in the third quarter, which Fox attributes to high inventory levels and a challenging economic environment for consumers.

title: The Coca‑Cola Company is First to Launch Multiple Sparkling Brands in 100% Recycled Plastic Bottles* Across Canada
summary: The Coca-Cola Company is launching multiple sparkling brands in 100% recycled plastic bottles across Canada by early 2024, marking a significant step towards a circular economy for plastic packaging. This initiative, excluding caps and labels, is projected to save 7.6 million pounds of new plastic and reduce nearly 7,000 metric tons of CO2 emissions annually. To celebrate, Coca-Cola Canada is hosting "The Replay Arcade" in Toronto, encouraging consumers to recycle and experience the new bottles.

title: The Untold Truth Of Farmer Brothers Coffee
summary: Farmer Brothers Coffee, established in 1912, has a long history of supplying coffee, tea, and spices, primarily to hotels, restaurants, and other institutions across the U.S., becoming a significant player despite not being a household name like Starbucks. The company faced challenges from founder's son's leadership, shareholder disputes, and a major relocation to Texas, which involved layoffs. Most recently, the COVID-19 pandemic significantly impacted its business, but stock market observers remain optimistic about its future recovery.

title: Colgate-Palmolive Opens AI-Infused Plant to Propel Hill’s Growth
summary: Colgate-Palmolive has opened a new 365,000-square-foot AI-infused manufacturing plant in Tonganoxie, KS, for its Hill’s Pet Nutrition brand to overcome capacity constraints and drive growth. The advanced facility utilizes artificial intelligence, automation, and robotics, including automated guided vehicles and autonomous mobile robots, to enhance efficiency and food safety. This investment aims to boost Hill's Pet Nutrition's rapid growth, which has consistently been a strong performer for Colgate-Palmolive, and expand its presence in the wet pet food category.

title: Pizza Fans Can Recycle Plastic Bottles for Free Slices and Coke Beverages | News Article
summary: Coca-Cola is launching a "Toss In, Take Out" program in New York, Atlanta, and Chicago to celebrate the expanded availability of bottles made from 100% recycled plastic. Consumers can bring any empty plastic beverage bottle to recycle and receive a free pizza slice and a 20-oz. Coca-Cola beverage in a 100% recycled plastic bottle. This initiative supports Coca-Cola's "World Without Waste" goal to reduce virgin plastic and promote a circular economy.

title: Coca-Cola Company and Pernod Ricard partner on Absolut Vodka with Sprite
summary: Coca-Cola Company and Pernod Ricard announced a partnership to launch a ready-to-drink Absolut Vodka & Sprite pre-mixed cocktail in early 2024, initially in select European countries. This move continues Coca-Cola's expansion into the alcohol space, leveraging its popular brands through various partnerships. The companies aim to capitalize on the growing ready-to-drink category and the popularity of vodka with lemon-lime mixers.

title: Coca-Cola & Beloved Local U.S. Pizzerias Are Offering Up Their Iconic Pizza In Exchange For Recycling A Bottle
summary: Coca-Cola is partnering with local pizzerias across the U.S. for "Toss In, Take Out," a traveling restaurant takeover event where consumers can exchange an empty plastic bottle for a slice of pizza and a Coca-Cola beverage. This initiative celebrates the expansion of Coca-Cola's 20-oz bottles made from 100% recycled plastic to new markets like Chicago, Atlanta, and the Pacific Northwest, aiming to reduce virgin plastic and CO2 emissions. The program supports Coca-Cola's "World Without Waste" goal of using at least 50% recycled material in bottles and cans by 2030 globally.

title: 3 Must-Buy Stocks for the Coming Mexico Boom
summary: This article identifies three Mexican companies as "must-buy" stocks due to Mexico's burgeoning industries and potential economic growth. The recommended stocks are Grupo Financiero Banorte (GBOOY), Femsa (FMX), and Grupo Aeroportuario del Pacifico (PAC), highlighting their strong financial metrics, market positions, and growth prospects despite broader concerns about corruption in Mexico.

title: Dividend Aristocrats may shine again if the Fed causes another bad year for the stock market
summary: The article suggests that Dividend Aristocrats, which performed well during the 2022 market downturn, could again be a strong investment if rising interest rates lead to another challenging year for the broader stock market. With investors becoming nervous due to increasing long-term rates, dividend stocks are presented as a potential safe haven. The piece indicates that the S&P Dividend Aristocrats, defined by S&P Dow Jones Indices, may warrant increased investor consideration.

title: Cisco to buy cybersecurity firm Splunk for $28 billion
summary: Cisco Systems agreed to acquire cybersecurity firm Splunk for approximately $28 billion, marking its largest-ever deal aimed at bolstering its software business and leveraging the AI boom. This acquisition is expected to reduce Cisco's reliance on its networking equipment business and accelerate revenue growth and gross margin expansion. Despite potential antitrust scrutiny, both companies anticipate the deal, valued at $157 per share for Splunk, to close by the end of the third quarter of 2024.

title: Colgate, Coca-Cola detail packaging sustainability efforts at Pack Expo
summary: Colgate-Palmolive and Coca-Cola presented their sustainability initiatives at Pack Expo, highlighting successful transitions to more recyclable packaging materials and consumer education efforts. Both companies discussed the internal and external barriers encountered in achieving their ambitious sustainability goals, emphasizing the need for scientific approaches and widespread communication. They detailed specific product changes, such as Sprite's switch to clear PET bottles and Tom's of Maine's use of PCR, alongside broader operational strategies to reduce environmental impact.

title: Here's why Johnson & Johnson just ditched one of the world's oldest logos
summary: Johnson & Johnson has replaced its iconic 135-year-old cursive logo with a cleaner, sans-serif design. This change reflects the company's shift in focus to innovative pharmaceuticals and medical devices after spinning off its consumer healthcare business. The new logo aims for better legibility and a more modern identity aligned with its updated corporate strategy.

title: Better Stock Buy: Coca-Cola vs. Procter & Gamble
summary: This article compares Coca-Cola and Procter & Gamble, two major consumer staples companies, to determine which is a better stock buy. It highlights their similarities in business resilience and dividend history, while scrutinizing their differences in product offerings and, critically, their current valuations based on price-to-sales, price-to-earnings, and price-to-book ratios. The analysis concludes that Coca-Cola appears more attractively priced historically compared to P&G.

title: The Coca-Cola Company and Partners Help Restore Drought-Stressed Watersheds in the Colorado River Basin
summary: The Coca-Cola Company, The Coca-Cola Foundation, and Swire Coca-Cola are actively supporting a project to restore drought-stressed watersheds in the Colorado River Basin. This initiative involves installing man-made beaver dams in Trail Creek to re-wet the landscape and support natural ecosystems. This effort is part of Coca-Cola's broader 2030 Water Security Strategy and a decade-long partnership with the National Forest Foundation to restore watersheds across the United States.

title: Freshpet strikes cooperative agreement with JANA Partners
summary: Freshpet has reached a cooperative agreement with activist investor JANA Partners following a recent proxy battle. The agreement includes the appointment of Timothy McLevish and Joseph E. Scalzo to Freshpet’s board of directors, bringing CPG leadership and financial expertise. JANA Partners has agreed to withdraw its previous director nominations and support Freshpet's slate of directors at the upcoming annual meeting.

title: Southern Company and PGA TOUR partner to power TOUR Championship with 100% renewable energy for second consecutive year
summary: Southern Company has partnered with the PGA TOUR to power the TOUR Championship with 100% renewable energy for the second consecutive year, emphasizing their commitment to sustainability. The initiative includes renewable energy credits, renewable natural gas, zero-emission battery storage, electric golf carts, and renewable diesel. This effort aligns with Southern Company's goal of achieving net-zero emissions across its operations by 2050, having already reduced greenhouse gas emissions by 46% in 2022.

title: Coca-Cola Hosts Digital Artists and Tech Enthusiasts for Generative AI Summit
summary: Coca-Cola hosted its first "Real Magic Creative Academy" in Atlanta, bringing together digital artists and tech enthusiasts to explore generative AI. The three-day summit included learning sessions and co-creation workshops, giving participants access to Coca-Cola brand assets and AI tools to develop new creative works. This initiative builds on Coca-Cola's "Create Real Magic" campaign, emphasizing the company's commitment to leveraging emerging technologies for artistic collaboration and innovation.

title: ‘Masterpiece’ Collection Fetches More Than $500k in Coinbase Drop
summary: Coca-Cola's "Masterpiece" digital art collection sold for over $543,000 during Coinbase’s “Onchain Summer” event, celebrating the launch of its Base blockchain. The collection, which mingles classical paintings with contemporary art and Coca-Cola branding, draws inspiration from a global campaign and film. This initiative marks Coca-Cola's continued engagement with Web3 and NFTs, following previous collectibles for International Friendship Day and Pride Month.

title: How Mars, Colgate-Palmolive, Nestle & Coca-Cola are Exploring Generative AI
summary: This article details how major CPGs like Mars, Colgate-Palmolive, Nestle, and Coca-Cola are exploring generative AI to enhance efficiency, drive innovation, and improve consumer engagement. It highlights specific use cases ranging from pet health prediction and product formulation to marketing content creation and consumer experiences, while also emphasizing the critical need for responsible and ethical implementation of AI technologies. Each company is leveraging AI in unique ways to gain a competitive edge and redefine various operational and customer-facing functions.

title: Ball says Q2 volumes declined due to US beer controversy, Russia divestment
summary: Ball reported an 11% decline in global beverage volumes in Q2, primarily due to the sale of its Russian business and a "notable domestic beer brand experiencing demand disruption in North America." The company also maintained its free cash flow guidance for 2023 and is exploring options for its aerospace business.

title: AB InBev’s Global Growth Offsets Bud Light Marketing Fiasco
summary: Anheuser-Busch InBev NV's profit growth exceeded analyst expectations, driven by strong sales in Brazil, China, and Colombia. This international growth successfully counterbalanced a significant 28% drop in US sales, which was attributed to the Bud Light marketing controversy. The company maintained its profit guidance for 2023, and its stock saw a notable increase.

title: Greenwashing Class Action Litigation: An Emerging Risk for Companies’ Claims of Sustainability
summary: Recent regulatory actions and consumer trends have led many companies to make public claims about their products' sustainability. This has, in turn, inspired a surge of "greenwashing" class-action lawsuits, alleging false advertising against companies unable to substantiate their claims. This article examines the factors driving this litigation trend, representative cases with varying outcomes, and offers recommendations for companies to minimize their exposure to such claims.

title: P&G Beats Profit and Sales Estimates on Higher Prices
summary: Procter & Gamble (PG) surpassed profit and sales estimates for its fiscal 2023 fourth quarter, driven by higher prices for its products, even while facing increased costs. Shares rose over 3% following the announcement. However, the company's outlook for fiscal 2024 fell below forecasts due to anticipated macroeconomic challenges.

title: Kenvue CEO says consumers are spending on brand-name health products even as they pull back in other areas
summary: Kenvue CEO Thibaut Mongon notes that consumers are prioritizing brand-name health and personal care products like Tylenol and Neutrogena, even as they cut spending in other areas. This trend, driven by a focus on health and trust in established brands, is also benefiting beauty and beverage companies that see less trade-down pressure. Kenvue expects continued strong demand, with 2023 sales projected to increase by 4.5% to 5.5%.

title: Better Buy: Procter & Gamble vs. Clorox
summary: This article compares Procter & Gamble (PG) and Clorox (CLX), concluding that P&G is the better buy primarily due to its significantly larger marketing budget and ability to dominate competitive markets. While Clorox leads in niche categories, P&G's financial muscle allows it to consistently out-promote competitors and maintain an "unfair advantage" in consumer staples. The article emphasizes that P&G's size allows it to better navigate consumer price sensitivity and market competition.

title: 3 Gold ETFs to Buy for Easy Exposure to the Precious Metal
summary: This article recommends three gold ETFs for investors seeking easy exposure to the precious metal amidst concerns about economic recession and inflation. The recommended funds are Graniteshares Gold Trust ETF (BAR), SPDR Gold Shares ETF (GLD), and iShares Gold Trust Micro (IAUM), each offering distinct advantages such as low fees, large asset holdings, or ultra-low expense ratios. The article highlights gold's role as a safe haven asset and notes its recent price strengthening and proximity to all-time highs.

title: Sigue el conflicto gremial con una embotelladora de Coca-Cola y amenaza con provocar faltantes en góndolas
summary: A labor dispute at a Coca-Cola bottling plant in Córdoba, Argentina, belonging to Coca-Cola Andina, threatens product shortages. The conflict stems from workers' claims of "unjustified dismissals" and demands for better labor rights and salaries, while the company asserts the conflict is politically motivated and without foundation. This situation has escalated to legal action due to alleged violent incidents.

title: Examining the Importance of Dividend Growth
summary: This article contrasts dividend growth investing with high-yield strategies, highlighting its benefits like reduced volatility and steadily rising payouts. It uses Warren Buffett's investments in companies like Coca-Cola and American Express to demonstrate the long-term efficacy of reinvesting growing dividends. The piece concludes by suggesting dividend growth ETFs, such as the T. Rowe Price Dividend Growth ETF (TDVG), as an accessible option for retail investors.

title: Colgate-Palmolive beats Q4 profit estimates helped by price hikes
summary: Colgate-Palmolive (India) Ltd's fourth-quarter profit fell less than expected, helped by price hikes implemented to combat surging costs. The company reported a 2.3% fall in net profit to 3.16 billion rupees, while sales rose nearly 4% to 13.42 billion rupees due to price increases. Its better-than-feared earnings follow previous drops in profit and come as other consumer goods makers also report mixed earnings for the March quarter.

title: Governor Hochul Announces Plans for the Coca-Cola Company to Build $650 Million fairlife® Production Facility in Monroe County | Empire State Development
summary: Governor Kathy Hochul announced that The Coca-Cola Company will build a $650 million fairlife production facility in Monroe County, New York, creating approximately 250 new jobs. This investment highlights New York's strong agribusiness sector and commitment to economic development in the Finger Lakes region. The facility, expected to be operational by Q4 2025, will significantly increase fairlife's production capacity for its ultra-filtered milk products.

title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has been a fortress stock during recessions and bear markets. Here's how
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has proven to be a resilient investment, consistently outperforming the S&P 500 during recessions and bear markets due to its long-term focus and conservative investment strategies. The conglomerate's significant stake in Apple, coupled with its substantial cash reserves and insurance ventures, underscores its "fortress stock" reputation. This approach has led to impressive compounded annual gains for Berkshire shareholders over decades.

title: 30% of Dow Shareholders Urge Company to Study Future With Less Virgin Plastic
summary: A shareholder resolution filed with Dow Inc. by As You Sow, requesting the company report on the impact of reduced global demand for virgin plastic, received support from over 30% of shareholders. This proposal highlights the growing concern over single-use plastics and the need for companies like Dow, a major producer of plastic resins, to assess their reliance on these materials. The resolution also sought disclosure on the cost-effectiveness, efficiency, and environmental soundness of chemical recycling technologies Dow plans to use.

title: iShares Global Consumer Staples ETF (KXI) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides an in-depth look at the iShares Global Consumer Staples ETF (KXI), detailing its stock price, holdings, dividend yield, and key statistics. It highlights top holdings such as Costco, Nestle, PepsiCo, and Philip Morris International, along with historical performance metrics and asset allocation. The report also includes information from its latest N-PORT filing, showing 95 total holdings with a portfolio value of $854.00 million.

title: Starbucks Corp. stock outperforms competitors on strong trading day
summary: Starbucks Corp. stock rose 0.83% to $102.44 on Monday, breaking a six-day losing streak, amidst a generally positive day for the stock market. The company's stock outperformed some competitors like Coca-Cola Co. and PepsiCo Inc. which saw slight declines, though McDonald's Corp. also rose. Starbucks closed $8.39 below its 52-week high, with trading volume below its 50-day average.

title: Vita Coco’s reinvention: How reassessing its customer base is paying off
summary: Vita Coco has seen significant sales and marketing growth after reassessing its core customer base, shifting focus from "yoga moms" to a younger, urban, and multicultural demographic. The company is exploring new consumption occasions, including alcohol mixers, and considering M&A opportunities in the healthy beverage space, while also carefully growing other brands in its portfolio like Runa and PWR LIFT. This strategic pivot has allowed Vita Coco to maintain profitability and market leadership despite past category slowdowns and exits by beverage giants.

title: Strong Drinks Brand + Strong Regional Market = Bullish Gains Ahead
summary: Embotelladora Andina S.A. (NYSE: AKO.B), a primary distributor of Coca-Cola products in Latin America, is projected for "Strong Bullish" gains due to the significant growth in nonalcoholic beverage sales in the region. The company boasts strong financial performance, an impressive 94 out of 100 on the Stock Power Ratings system, and is expected to outperform the broader market by 3X within the next 12 months. Its strong quality, value, and momentum factors, combined with a 15.2% dividend, make it a compelling investment.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper grows as company, gains on competition
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper, America's third-largest soft drink maker, is growing and gaining market share despite the overall decline in soda consumption. The company increased its dollar share by 9% from 2003 to 2021, now holding 25% of the U.S. retail market, behind Coca-Cola (40%) and Pepsi (29%). This growth highlights Keurig Dr Pepper's success in a competitive beverage industry.

title: Kellogg divests Russian operations to local snacks maker Chernogolovka
summary: Kellogg Co announced its decision to divest its Russian operations to local snacks and drinks maker Chernogolovka, joining other Western brands leaving the country. This move follows Kellogg's earlier suspension of product imports and investments in Russia due to the Ukraine invasion. Chernogolovka, known for snacks and beverages, has also stepped in to supply soft drinks to Russian fast-food outlets after major soda companies halted sales.

title: Coca-Cola Business Model
summary: This article details the Coca-Cola business model, outlining its historical development, revenue streams, customer segments, value propositions, and operational aspects. It also includes a comprehensive SWOT analysis, examining the company's strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats in the global beverage industry. The analysis highlights Coca-Cola's strong brand, global reach, and diversified product portfolio as key strengths, while addressing challenges like reliance on sugary drinks, environmental impact, and increasing competition.

title: Last Call: Judge Sends Beer Definition Lawsuit to Trial; Ontario Craft Brewery M&A On Fire; Molson Coors Discontinues Sharp’s, Coors Pure
summary: A federal judge has sent a lawsuit regarding the definition of beer between Grupo Modelo and Constellation Brands to trial, focusing on whether hard seltzers fall under their licensing agreement. Concurrently, the Canadian craft beer market is active with Carlsberg acquiring Waterloo Brewing for C$144 million, and SymBev Inc. acquiring three Ontario breweries. Meanwhile, Molson Coors is discontinuing its Sharp’s non-alcoholic and Coors Pure brands due to underperformance.

title: The Coca-Cola Company Partners with Musical Legends Mark Ronson and Madlib to Launch “Recycled Records”
summary: The Coca-Cola Company has partnered with musical legends Mark Ronson and Madlib to launch "Recycled Records," a campaign featuring an original EP and sound library created from the sounds of the bottle-to-bottle recycling process. This initiative celebrates Sprite, Fresca, and Seagram’s transition from green to clear plastic packaging, aiming to increase the availability of high-quality, food-grade recycled plastic. Fans can also interact with a digital beat machine to create their own compositions using the sounds, highlighting the connection between music sampling and the closed-loop recycling process.

title: Coca-Cola United automates over 50,000 orders in complex SAP invoicing process with Microsoft Power Platform
summary: Coca-Cola United has significantly improved its operational efficiency by using Microsoft Power Platform to automate two key processes: on-demand shipment requests and a complex SAP invoicing process. The automation reduced order validation time from half a day to seconds and enabled the processing of over 50,000 orders, freeing up valuable employee time and supporting strategic growth. The company plans to continue automating more business processes using Microsoft Power Automate RPA capabilities, further reducing labor costs and improving accuracy.

title: Former Coca-Cola Exec Melanie Boulden Joins Tyson as Chief Growth Officer
summary: Tyson Foods Inc. announced Melanie Boulden, former chief marketing officer at Coca-Cola North America, will join the company as its first chief growth officer. In her new role, Boulden will oversee brand marketing for Tyson Foods' diverse portfolio and is expected to start on February 8. CEO Donnie King highlighted her experience and the importance of this new role for driving future growth.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper spends $863M for stake in C4 Energy maker
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper is acquiring a 30% stake in Nutrabolt, the maker of C4 Energy and Xtend Energy drinks, for $863 million. This deal includes a long-term sales and distribution agreement, giving Keurig Dr Pepper a significant entry into the rapidly growing performance energy drink market. The investment strategically positions Keurig Dr Pepper to adapt to changing consumer trends in the beverage industry.

title: PepsiCo sets global packaging goals following shareholder scrutiny
summary: PepsiCo has set an ambitious global packaging goal for 2030, aiming to deliver up to 20% of its beverage servings through reusable models, doubling its current rate. This move is part of the PepsiCo Positive (pep+) sustainability programme and is accelerated by shareholder pressure, particularly from "As You Sow." The company plans to expand its SodaStream business and work with bottlers to increase reusable plastic and glass bottle offerings to achieve this target.

title: John Murphy to Become President and Chief Financial Officer of The Coca-Cola Company
summary: The Coca-Cola Company announced that John Murphy will become President and Chief Financial Officer, effective October 1. Murphy will add the president role following the retirement of Brian Smith, who served as president and chief operating officer since 2019. This change will expand Murphy's duties to include oversight of Global Ventures, Platform Services, O2O digital transformation, and customer and commercial leadership.

title: Coca-Cola's Plastic Pollution Problem
summary: The Sierra Club criticizes Coca-Cola for its significant plastic pollution, highlighting the company's annual production of 3 million tons of plastic packaging and its alleged misleading recycling claims. The article discusses Coca-Cola's history of prioritizing plastic over more recyclable materials like aluminum and details a lawsuit filed by the Sierra Club against Coca-Cola regarding false advertising of its bottles' recyclability.

title: Coke’s sustainably chief throws down a marker on regulations for reporting supplier emissions
summary: Coca-Cola's chief sustainability officer, Bea Perez, announced the company's support for the SEC's proposed regulations on supplier emissions, or Scope 3 emissions, despite previous quibbles regarding implementation details for smaller suppliers. Perez emphasized the need for fairness and consistency in reporting, while Kristina Wyatt, formerly of the SEC, clarified that the proposed rules allow for flexibility, including using industry benchmarks for smaller entities during a phase-in period. The article highlights Coca-Cola's existing voluntary climate targets to reduce total greenhouse gas emissions by 25% by 2030 and its ambition for net-zero carbon emissions by 2050.

title: Coca-Cola creates new role of president, International Development
summary: The Coca-Cola Company has appointed Henrique Braun to the newly created role of President, International Development, effective January 1, 2023. Braun will oversee seven operating units covering dozens of countries and territories, reporting directly to CEO James Quincey. This new role expands his responsibilities beyond his current position as president of the Latin America operating unit, which he has held since 2020.

title: The Coca-Cola Company Names Henrique Braun to Newly Created Role of President, International Development
summary: The Coca-Cola Company announced the creation of a new role, President, International Development, and named Henrique Braun to fill it, effective January 1, 2023. Braun will oversee seven operating units, including Latin America, Japan and South Korea, Africa, and others. John Murphy, President and CFO, will also take on oversight of the Bottling Investments Group.

title: What Can Brands Learn from Coca-Cola’s Greenwashing Lawsuit Win?
summary: Coca-Cola successfully defended itself against a greenwashing lawsuit filed by Earth Island Institute, which accused the company of false advertising regarding its sustainability claims. The court dismissed the case primarily because Coca-Cola's statements were deemed aspirational, not actionable, and not directly tied to product labeling. This ruling suggests a potential challenge for future greenwashing claims against companies, especially regarding general corporate ethos statements.

title: Coca-Cola Femsa aumenta los precios de refrescos, agua y leche
summary: Coca-Cola Femsa announced a third price increase for its products, including soft drinks, water, and milk, effective November 28th. The price hike, ranging from 1 to 2 pesos, is attributed to rising raw material costs and inflation. Specific price adjustments are detailed for various Coca-Cola, flavored soft drinks, Santa Clara milk, Ades products, and Ciel water presentations.

title: Meet The Markets: Introducing Spain
summary: This article introduces Coca-Cola Europacific Partners (CCEP) in Spain, highlighting its history, economic contribution, and commitment to sustainability and community programs. It details CCEP Spain's innovation in product offerings, significant job creation, and environmental efforts like emissions reduction, plastic recycling, and waste collection. Key facts and figures demonstrate CCEP's substantial presence and impact on the Spanish economy and environment.

title: Coca-Cola Rethinks Hybrid Work to Tell a Better Workplace Story
summary: Coca-Cola is rethinking its hybrid work strategy to create a more compelling workplace story for its employees, focusing on connection, social capital, and flexible office design. This initiative, highlighted at the CoreNet Global Summit, involved redesigning their Singapore headquarters to reflect local culture and provide varied work areas to support hybrid work. The article emphasizes that a successful hybrid model requires more than just technology, integrating aesthetic design, amenities, and HR policies to enhance the employee experience and attract workers back to the office.

title: Coca Cola Christmas Truck confirms its return for 2022
summary: Coca-Cola has confirmed the return of its Christmas Truck Tour for 2022, featuring a winter market theme and supporting FareShare by donating up to 100,000 meals to those in need. The tour will offer interactive activities, personalized Coca-Cola products, and will see the beloved "Holidays Are Coming" advert return to TV. For the first time, Coca-Cola is also collaborating with RNIB and NaviLens to make its packaging accessible for blind and partially sighted people.

title: Coca-Cola Co.’s Mojo Kombucha shuts factory, warns products to disappear from shelves
summary: Coca-Cola Co.'s Mojo Beverages brand, known for Mojo Kombucha, is closing its kombucha factory. As a result, its products will no longer be available on shelves in the near future. The company stated this was a difficult decision.

title: COP27 Sponsor The Coca-Cola Company named worst plastic polluter for five years in a row according to 2022 Brand Audit
summary: The Coca-Cola Company, PepsiCo, and Nestlé have been identified as the world's top plastic polluters for the fifth consecutive year, according to the 2022 Brand Audit by Break Free From Plastic. This report highlights the ineffectiveness of corporate voluntary commitments in reducing environmental impact, with plastic packaging use actually increasing for many companies. Activists are advocating for a legally-binding Global Plastics Treaty to enforce reductions in plastic production and promote reuse-based alternatives, especially as Coca-Cola sponsors COP27 despite its significant plastic footprint.

title: Kraft Heinz Bets (Even) Bigger On Supply Chain Visibility
summary: Kraft Heinz is deepening its partnership with Microsoft, adopting the new Supply Chain Center to enhance supply chain visibility through AI-backed capabilities. This initiative is part of a larger transformation to integrate and centralize data, allowing for more agile risk assessment and improved product delivery across North America. The platform leverages AI models for demand and supply insights, order management automation, and Teams integration to streamline operations and decision-making.

title: Coca-Cola Seeing 'Encouraging Results' From Alcoholic Beverages Launches
summary: The Coca-Cola Company is reporting encouraging early results from its alcoholic beverage partnerships with Molson Coors and Constellation Brands for Simply Spiked Lemonade and Fresca Mixed. This follows their initial foray into the ready-to-drink alcoholic market with Lemon-Dou in 2018 in Japan. These initiatives support Coca-Cola's strategy to become a "total beverage company" with options for all occasions and need states.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper CEO pushed out after 3 months over personal conduct ‘violations’
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper CEO Ozan Dokmecioglu resigned after less than four months in the role due to unspecified violations of the company's Code of Conduct related to personal behavior, not strategy or financial reporting. Former CEO Bob Gamgort will return to the top position. The company emphasized its commitment to ethics and integrity for all employees.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper invests $50M in Athletic Brewing
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper has invested $50 million in Athletic Brewing, a nonalcoholic craft beer maker, acquiring a minority stake and a board seat. This investment is part of Athletic Brewing's $75 million fundraising round and reflects Keurig Dr Pepper's strategy to expand into the rapidly growing nonalcoholic beverage category. The move contrasts with competitors who are entering the ready-to-drink alcoholic beverage market.

title: Coca-Cola Supplies Alcorn Athletics with Gift
summary: Coca-Cola has gifted Alcorn State University Athletics with a new, fully-branded 35-foot equipment truck, capable of carrying over 6,000 pounds of gear. This donation is the result of a partnership between Alcorn President Dr. Felecia Nave and Coca-Cola representatives Russ Hendley and Mario Lee, providing a mobile billboard and essential transport for the Braves. The truck was presented on November 9, 2022, outside Jack Spinks – Marino Casem Stadium, and also came filled with Coca-Cola beverages.

title: Coca-Cola to restructure North American workforce with voluntary buyouts
summary: Coca-Cola is implementing a "voluntary separation program" including employee buyouts to restructure its North American workforce of approximately 6,000 people. This move follows previous restructurings and job cuts aimed at streamlining operations and focusing on growing brands, though the company states this current initiative is not primarily for cost-cutting. Employees have a short window, November 14-18, to decide on accepting the buyout offer.

title: Coke Is a Sponsor of the Climate Summit in Egypt. Some Activists Aren’t Happy. (Published 2022)
summary: Coca-Cola's sponsorship of the COP27 climate summit in Egypt has drawn strong criticism from climate activists, who point to the company's increasing plastic production as detailed in a recent report. Activists argue that Coca-Cola, named the world's leading plastic polluter in 2021, is greenwashing its image while its plastic use, largely derived from fossil fuels, continues to rise. Despite Coca-Cola's claims of environmental commitments, a report from the Ellen MacArthur Foundation indicates that the company will likely miss its target for recyclable or compostable packaging by 2025.

title: Coca-Cola plastic packaging up by 8.8% in one year
summary: Oceana reports that The Coca-Cola Company's plastic packaging increased by 8.8% in one year, amounting to over 579 million pounds. This increase occurred despite pledges to boost recycled content and decrease virgin plastic use, which the company failed to significantly advance. Oceana urges Coca-Cola to focus on increasing refillable bottle systems, which are more effective in reducing plastic pollution and carbon footprint than recycling efforts alone.

title: The anti-ESG funds exploiting the US political divide
summary: The article discusses the rise of anti-ESG funds in the US, which are exploiting the political divide by offering investments that prioritize shareholder value over socially responsible agendas. These funds, such as Strive Asset Management and ACVF, cater to investors who believe ESG investing is politically motivated and detrimental to financial returns. Despite their growing media attention, experts question their overall impact on corporate behavior and capital movement compared to traditional large asset managers.

title: Flows Into Consumer Staples ETFs Rebound on Economic Uncertainty
summary: Investors are increasingly moving back into consumer staples ETFs, a defensive strategy during economic uncertainty. The Invesco S&P 500® Equal Weight Consumer Staples ETF (RHS) has seen significant net inflows, indicating a preference for equal-weighted approaches to mitigate company-specific risks that are common in market-cap weighted funds dominated by a few large companies. This shift reflects advisors' search for downside protection while still participating in market upside in the current economic climate.

title: Coca-Cola Europacific Partners has pulled its signature mixers range
summary: Coca-Cola Europacific Partners (CCEP) has discontinued its Signature Mixers range in the UK, citing a strategy focused on prioritizing best-performing brands. CCEP aims to streamline its portfolio and concentrate on widely appealing "hero products" in the competitive soft drinks market.

title: Coca-Cola prioritizes offering more value to consumers: ‘We're not chasing the competitors. We're chasing the consumers and the retailers,’ says CEO
summary: Coca-Cola is focusing on delivering increased value to consumers by introducing products at more affordable price points, amid a challenging global economic environment. Chairman and CEO James Quincey emphasized that the company is "chasing the consumers and the retailers," rather than competitors, to drive growth. This strategy includes investments in sports drinks like BODYARMOR and Powerade, along with offering affordable options like smaller multi-packs to address consumer pressures.

title: Coca-Cola lifts forecasts as demand keeps pace with pricier sodas
authors: Uday Sampath Kumar and Granth Vanaik
summary: Coca-Cola Co (KO.N) raised its annual forecasts after strong Q3 results, mirroring rival PepsiCo, as multiple price increases for its sodas did not deter consumer demand. Despite concerns about inflation's impact on consumer spending in some regions, the company plans to introduce smaller capacity bottles to stabilize prices, and beat analyst expectations for both revenue and profit.

title: UN’s Coke sponsorship leaves bad taste with environmentally conscious groups
summary: Coca-Cola's sponsorship of the COP27 U.N. climate summit has sparked outrage among environmental groups and activists, who accuse the company of "greenwash" due to its significant contribution to plastic pollution. Critics argue that corporate involvement, especially from major polluters, undermines the integrity of climate negotiations and provides a marketing platform rather than genuine commitment to environmental solutions. The controversy highlights broader concerns about corporate lobbying and influence at critical international climate conferences.

title: The Coca‑Cola Company in South Africa continues to offer consumers choice
summary: The Coca-Cola Company (TCCC) in South Africa continues to prioritize consumer choice by offering seven low-calorie/low-kilojoule carbonated cold drinks, despite a global portfolio refresh that included discontinuing TaB. This strategy, according to Silke Bucker, Senior Marketing Director, is consumer-centric, aiming to satisfy evolving consumer needs and provide diverse options, including new products like Coca-Cola No Sugar No Caffeine. TCCC's focus remains on listening to and responding to consumer demand to accelerate its transformation into a total beverage company.

title: PepsiCo Boosted by Higher Prices
summary: PepsiCo reported stronger-than-expected third-quarter sales, prompting the company to raise its full-year revenue and earnings forecast. While sales volumes were down slightly, a significant 17% surge in pricing drove the positive results, with higher prices not deterring customers. Despite increased costs and marketing spend, PepsiCo's net income rose 21% to $2.7 billion, exceeding Wall Street's forecasts.

title: PepsiCo’s Higher Prices for Soda and Snacks Test Consumers’ Resolve
summary: PepsiCo has increased prices on its snacks and drinks by an average of 17% over the last year, leading to a rise in third-quarter sales. This move tests consumer willingness to continue purchasing at higher costs amidst record food inflation in the U.S. Companies are closely monitoring consumer reactions to these price hikes, as food inflation hit 13.5% in August compared to the previous year.

title: Coca-Cola FEMSA recompra 299.8 millones de dólares en bonos
summary: Coca-Cola FEMSA conducted a public offer to repurchase $299.8 million of its outstanding senior bonds due in 2043 and 2030. HSBC and J.P. Morgan acted as dealer managers for the offer, which initially had a cap of $250 million but was increased due to high demand. The company was advised by Cleary Gottlieb Steen & Hamilton, while the banks received legal support from Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom and Galicia Abogados.

title: BBVA México es intermediario colocador en la primera emisión de un bono social emitido por un corporativo en México, Coca-Cola FEMSA
summary: BBVA México acted as the placement agent and social structuring agent for Coca-Cola FEMSA's successful issuance of MXN 6 billion in sustainable and social bonds. This marks the first social bond issuance by a corporate in the consumer sector in the Americas and for the Coca-Cola System, with funds dedicated to social and sustainability projects. The bond issuance reinforces Coca-Cola FEMSA's commitment to community development and environmental goals, as well as BBVA México's role in promoting sustainable finance.

title: PEP Stock: Is PepsiCo a safe investment in the bear market?
summary: PepsiCo (NASDAQ: PEP) is considered a safe investment due to its strong fundamentals, brand loyalty, and consistent financial performance, even amidst economic challenges. While its valuation appears high after recent gains, its attractiveness as a dividend stock and long-term investment remains, though short-term market volatility might be a concern. The company is set to release its Q3 2022 results on October 12, with analysts expecting continued growth in earnings and revenues.

title: How Coca-Cola’s sustainable supply chain finance programme works
summary: Coca-Cola Europacific Partners (CCEP) has launched a €600m sustainability-linked supply chain finance program with Rabobank to incentivize its suppliers to reduce emissions, use renewable electricity, and share carbon data. This initiative aims to address the 90% of CCEP's emissions that come from its supply chain and supports the company's net-zero targets. Suppliers meeting specific KPIs receive a discount on early payments, with the program rolling out globally by the end of the year.

title: Heartland Coca-Cola unveils plan to build production facility in southern Olathe
summary: Heartland Coca-Cola Bottling Company plans to build a new $250 million production facility in southern Olathe, projected to open in late 2024. The 600,000 square foot campus will replace their Lenexa plant operations, with all 175 production employees offered positions at the new site. The Olathe City Council approved a conditional development agreement and a benefit district to support the project, including potential tax abatements and funding for infrastructure improvements like a new road.

title: Constellation Brands Q2 Profit Tops Estimates; Beer Business Net Sales Up 15%
summary: Constellation Brands reported strong Q2 performance, with profit topping estimates and Beer Business net sales growing 15%. The company also increased its full-year net sales outlook for the Beer Business and declared a quarterly dividend. Additionally, Constellation Brands reached an agreement to divest a portion of its mainstream and premium wine portfolio.

title: Coca-Cola Opens West Coast HQ at Spectrum Terrace
summary: The Coca-Cola Co. has opened its new West Coast operations facility at the Spectrum Terrace office campus in Irvine, California. This nearly 10,000-square-foot office will serve as the headquarters for the company's West Zone operations, overseeing over a dozen states and territories. The new space is designed for "connection, collaboration and coaching" for its 125 employees and positions Coca-Cola closer to key markets and customers, including potential partnerships with companies like Amazon, which is also moving into the campus.

title: Biggest Plastic Polluter named Sponsor for COP27 – Greenpeace Reaction
summary: Greenpeace reacted to the announcement that Coca-Cola, identified as the world's biggest plastic polluter, will sponsor COP27. Greenpeace criticizes Coca-Cola for producing 120 billion throwaway plastic bottles annually, primarily from fossil fuels, which exacerbates both plastic and climate crises. They argue that this sponsorship undermines COP27's goals and urge Coca-Cola to end its reliance on single-use plastics to truly address climate change.

title: MOLSON COORS EXPANDS EXCLUSIVE AGREEMENT WITH THE COCA-COLA COMPANY TO LAUNCH TOPO CHICO SPIRITED LINE OF CANNED COCKTAILS
summary: Molson Coors Beverage Company has expanded its exclusive agreement with The Coca-Cola Company to launch Topo Chico Spirited, a new line of spirit-based, ready-to-drink canned cocktails. This move builds on the success of Topo Chico Hard Seltzer and Simply Spiked Lemonade, further expanding Molson Coors' premium beverage portfolio. Topo Chico Spirited will be available in over 20 markets in 2023, featuring cocktails made with 100% real spirits, including premium tequila.

title: Exclusive: PepsiCo ends Pepsi, 7UP production in Russia months after promising halt over Ukraine
summary: PepsiCo has stopped producing Pepsi, 7UP, and Mountain Dew in Russia, nearly six months after initially announcing a suspension of sales and production following the invasion of Ukraine. This decision came after Reuters found these products with recent production dates still widely available in Russia. The action aligns with PepsiCo's March 2022 pledge, though the company continues to sell essential goods like milk and baby food in the country.

title: Inside ASU's contract with Coca-Cola
summary: Arizona State University has a decade-long contract with Coca-Cola valued at $30 million, which includes stipulations for marketing Coke products and limits on competing beverages. Health experts and studies raise concerns about such contracts promoting sugar-sweetened beverages on university campuses, despite the financial benefits for ASU which go towards student engagement programs. The contract also involves extensive marketing requirements and raises questions about its impact on sustainability goals and student health choices.

title: Arca Continental announces new agreement with Coca-Cola
summary: Mexican bottling company Arca Continental has announced a new long-term collaboration agreement with Coca-Cola, covering markets in Mexico, Ecuador, Peru, and Argentina. This agreement aims to improve customer service, drive profitable growth, and implement better digital initiatives across Latin America. The collaboration underscores a long-standing commitment and seeks to align economic aspects, investments, and long-term business strategies for shared value creation.

title: Ogilvy Appoints Guillermo Vega Global Creative Lead for The Coca-Cola Company
summary: Ogilvy has appointed Guillermo Vega as the global creative network lead for The Coca-Cola Company, where he will be responsible for defining and driving the creative vision for TCCC's brand portfolio. Vega will be based in New York and join the leadership team of OpenX from WPP, the bespoke agency offering created for TCCC. His extensive experience includes leading Saatchi & Saatchi London and co-founding Wieden+Kennedy São Paulo, demonstrating a strong track record in growing creative agencies and working with significant brands.

title: Me & My Team: Coca-Cola Europacific Partners, East Kilbride
summary: Coca-Cola Europacific Partners' East Kilbride factory is implementing a major vision for digitalization and automation, supported by significant investments in sustainability and efficiency. The site has reduced its carbon footprint by 47% since 2010, invested £32m in the past five years, and is pioneering initiatives like attached bottle caps and advanced monitoring systems. The article highlights their focus on continuous improvement, talent development, and preparing for future regulatory changes like Scotland's deposit return scheme.

title: Clorox Leans Into Scenario Planning for Never-Normal Supply Chain Future
summary: Clorox is investing significantly in ERP and supply chain improvements to navigate a volatile environment, upgrading its 20-year-old ERP to a cloud-based system and implementing new supply chain capabilities as part of a $500 million digital transformation. The company is focusing on more frequent forecasting and scenario planning, recognizing that while supply chain stability is improving, it will not return to pre-pandemic conditions. Clorox aims to automate manual processes and leverage data for better visibility, cost reduction, and optimized inventory levels.

title: COCA-COLA PARTNERS WITH ATLANTA ARTISTS TO CELEBRATE ITS GEORGIA-BORN HERITAGE
summary: The Coca-Cola Company is partnering with eight local artists in Metro Atlanta to commission murals celebrating its Georgia-born heritage and the city's diverse culture. This initiative aims to feature Coca-Cola brands within the social tapestry of Atlanta's neighborhoods. One such mural by Fabian Williams is prominently displayed at the newly opened Black Art In America Gallery and Sculpture Garden in East Point, sponsored by Coca-Cola as part of this ongoing partnership.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper acquires equity stake in C4 Energy maker
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper is acquiring an approximately 30% ownership stake in Nutrabolt, the maker of C4 Energy, for $863 million. This investment also includes a long-term sales and distribution agreement to significantly expand C4 Energy's market presence. The move strengthens Keurig Dr Pepper's position in the rapidly growing performance energy drink market, making it Nutrabolt's largest investor behind its founder.

title: Coca-Cola Restructures Platform Services
summary: The Coca-Cola Company is restructuring its platform services organization by splitting leadership responsibilities. Barry Simpson will step down, and the group will be led by Neeraj Tolmare as global CIO for digital and technology services, and a second executive for other services, both reporting to John Murphy. This restructuring is part of a larger initiative to build a networked global organization, which the company CEO states is a work in progress with ongoing improvements.

title: Coca-Cola CEO sees alcohol as fourth bucket
summary: Coca-Cola CEO James Robert B. Quincey outlined a "bucket" strategy for the company, positioning the core Coke brand as the primary gold medalist. He identified alcohol as the "fourth bucket" or "true experimentation bucket," with growing potential, noting success in partnerships for products like Topo Chico Ranch Water Hard Seltzer and Simply Spiked. Despite the growth in alcoholic offerings, Quincey emphasized that the Coke brand remains the main driver of company sales and revenue.

title: Barry Simpson to Step Down as Chief Platform Services Officer of The Coca-Cola Company
summary: The Coca-Cola Company announced that Barry Simpson will step down from his role as chief Platform Services officer, effective September 30, 2022, and will remain a senior advisor until February 2023. Simpson, who led the Platform Services organization since its creation in 2021, will see his responsibilities restructured under two new leaders, Neeraj Tolmare as CIO and another yet-to-be-named executive, both reporting to John Murphy. The article also provides details about Simpson's 14-year career history within the Coca-Cola system and a brief overview of The Coca-Cola Company.

title: Starbucks taps PepsiCo veteran Laxman Narasimhan as CEO
summary: Starbucks Coffee Co. has appointed Laxman Narasimhan as its new CEO, effective October 1, 2022, succeeding interim CEO Howard Schultz. Narasimhan brings nearly 30 years of experience from global consumer-facing brands, including PepsiCo Inc., and will join the board of directors on April 1, 2023. During a transition period, he will immerse himself in the company's brand, culture, and "Reinvention" plan.

title: Coca-Cola appoints Jennifer Mann as president of North America operating unit
summary: The Coca-Cola Company has appointed Jennifer Mann as the new president of its North America operating unit, effective January 1, 2023. She will succeed Alfredo Rivera, who is stepping down after 38 years with the company. Mann, who joined Coca-Cola in 1997, currently serves as corporate senior vice president and president of Global Ventures.

title: Coca‑Cola supporting community access to clean and safe water through new 2030 Water Strategy
summary: Coca-Cola Philippines is strengthening its commitment to water stewardship with a new 2030 Water Strategy, focusing on increasing water use efficiency and addressing community water resource challenges. The company, through its Coca-Cola Foundation Philippines, has implemented initiatives like the Agos Program, which has made safe water accessible to underserved communities and enhanced water management practices. Coca-Cola Beverages Philippines, Inc. (CCBPI) was also recognized for its industry-leading water resource management, demonstrating a 31% decrease in absolute water consumption in 2020 and achieving a 132% water replenishment rate in the Philippines.

title: The Coca-Cola Company Appoints Jennifer Mann as President of the North America Operating Unit
summary: The Coca-Cola Company has appointed Jennifer Mann as the new president of its North America Operating Unit, effective January 1, 2023. She will succeed Alfredo Rivera, who will step down on December 31, 2022, and remain as a senior advisor until March 2023. Mann, who has been with Coca-Cola for 25 years, previously served as corporate senior vice president and president of Global Ventures, responsible for scaling acquisitions and brands such as Costa Coffee and Monster Beverage Corp.
source: Abasto, Food and Beverage Industry News
source_domain: Abasto, Food and Beverage Industry News

title: Coca-Cola Taps Jennifer Mann as President of Its North America Operating Unit
summary: Jennifer Mann has been appointed as the corporate senior vice president and president of Coca-Cola's North America operating unit, effective January 1, 2023. Mann, who previously led Global Ventures, has a 25-year career with the company and is recognized for scaling global acquisitions like Costa Coffee and Monster Beverage Corp. She will be replacing Alfredo Rivera, who is stepping down at the end of the year.

title: Conagra Brands names Tracy Schaefer SVP/CIO
summary: Conagra Brands Inc. has appointed Tracy Schaefer as Senior Vice President and Chief Information Officer, effective August 22, 2022. Schaefer has been with Conagra Brands since 2001 and has held various leadership roles in finance, IT, and global business services. CFO Dave Marberger highlighted her strong track record, deep business understanding, and strategic mindset as critical assets for the company's strategic plans.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper denies reported talks to buy Bang Energy drink owner
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper denied reports that it is in talks to acquire Bang Energy drink owner, though it confirmed that M&A and brand partnerships are key to its growth strategy. The negotiations, reported by Bloomberg, suggested a potential valuation of over $2 billion for Bang. An acquisition would significantly bolster Keurig Dr Pepper's presence in the growing energy drink market, following Bang's recent exit from a distribution deal with PepsiCo.

title: Monster Beverage Corp. stock outperforms competitors despite losses on the day
summary: Monster Beverage Corp. (MNST) stock declined by 0.58% on Thursday, closing at $89.30, yet still outperformed competitors Coca-Cola Co. and PepsiCo Inc. despite the market's mixed trading session. The stock closed $10.51 short of its 52-week high, with trading volume below its 50-day average. This performance highlights Monster Beverage's relative strength against its peers in a challenging market.

title: Coca-Cola's new flavor 'Dreamworld' supposedly tastes like dreams
summary: Coca-Cola is releasing "Dreamworld," its fourth and final limited-edition flavor in the Coca-Cola Creations series, which claims to taste like dreams. This abstract flavor is part of a marketing campaign targeting Gen Z, known for its unique flavors and multimedia collaborations, and is intended to provoke discovery and debate among consumers. The release is accompanied by an augmented reality music experience and a digital fashion collection, continuing the trend of conceptual flavors despite some criticism aimed at the company's "innovation."

title: Coca-Cola bottler to detail costs of exiting Russia
summary: Coca-Cola HBC AG, the bottler for Coca-Cola Co, is set to detail the costs associated with exiting Russia after five months of winding down operations. The bottler has stopped producing and selling Coke-branded products in Russia, renaming its local business Multon Partners and focusing on local brands. This full exit is critical for Coca-Cola Co's legal efforts in Russia to protect its brand and prevent unauthorized imports of its products.

title: Coke bottles taste of dreams for latest experimental flavor
summary: Coca-Cola has launched "Dreamworld," the fourth and final product from its Creations platform for 2022, aiming to capture the taste of dreams and target Gen Z consumers. The launch includes digital and experiential activations like an AR music experience with Tomorrowland and a digital fashion collection for the metaverse. This strategy follows previous Creations flavors, which have contributed to Coca-Cola's reported 12% year-on-year growth in net revenue to $11.3 billion.

title: Coca-Cola HBC agrees to acquire Three Cents
summary: Coca-Cola HBC AG announced its agreement to acquire ESM Effervescent Sodas Management Limited ("Three Cents") for an enterprise value of €45 million. Three Cents is a fast-growing, super-premium adult sparkling beverage and mixer business. This acquisition strengthens Coca-Cola HBC's 24/7 beverage partner strategy and expands its portfolio in the super-premium segment.

title: Coca-Cola distributor of the triangle announces plans to move operations to Chatham County, Apex
summary: The Durham Coca-Cola Bottling Company announced plans to relocate its operations to Chatham County, specifically at the intersection of Highway 751 and US 64, with an Apex address. The move involves constructing a 175,000-square-foot facility, bringing 180-200 employees, and aims for enhanced sustainable building specifications. The new location will centralize its service area, covering multiple counties in the Triangle region.

title: Coca-Cola to transition green plastic portfolio to clear PET bottles in North America
summary: The Coca-Cola Company is transitioning its green plastic beverage bottles, starting with Sprite in North America, to clear PET to improve recyclability into new beverage bottles. This move aims to increase the availability of food-grade recycled PET (rPET) and drive a circular economy for plastic. Additionally, DASANI will roll out bottles made from 100% recycled PET, and Coca-Cola has pledged to increase refillable/returnable packaging options globally by 2030.

title: Coca-Cola prioritizes core brands and focuses on digital strategy
summary: Coca-Cola's business in China improved in June 2022 due to a focus on core branded products and a shift to digital engagement as consumers moved to at-home consumption. The company's Q2 2022 global revenue rose 12 percent year-on-year to $11.33 billion, exceeding market expectations, and it saw strong unit case volume growth globally and in Asia Pacific, particularly in China. This growth was supported by new product launches and strong e-commerce performance during the "June 18" festival.

title: SEE IT: The Coca-Cola Company is making a big change to its Sprite bottles
summary: The Coca-Cola Company is changing its Sprite bottles from green plastic to clear plastic to improve recyclability and promote a "circular economy" for plastics. This move aims to increase the amount of recycled PET used in new beverage containers, addressing a demand that currently outpaces supply. Other Coca-Cola brands like Fresca, Seagram’s, Mello Yello, and Dasani are also transitioning to clear or 100% recycled bottles.

title: Jacksonville Jaguars Announce Partnership with Coca-Cola Beverages Florida
summary: The Jacksonville Jaguars announced a multi-year partnership with Coca-Cola Beverages Florida, LLC (Coke Florida), making it the team's official soft drink and water partner. This agreement grants Coke Florida exclusive rights to provide beverages like Coca-Cola brands and smartwater at TIAA Bank Field for Jaguars games and other events. Both organizations anticipate growth and new audience reach in the Jacksonville market through this collaboration.

title: Coca-Cola United to close Natchez facility in 2024
summary: Coca-Cola Bottling Co. United Inc. announced it would close its Natchez sales and distribution center in 2024 as part of an effort to optimize operations. All 40 Natchez employees will have the opportunity to apply for positions at nearby facilities, and the company stated that customers would not be impacted. This consolidation aims to achieve greater operational effectiveness without changing the company's commitment to associates, the Natchez community, and customers.

title: Coca-Cola to keep passing through costs
summary: Coca-Cola Co. plans to continue increasing prices on its products to offset rising commodity and operating costs, expecting organic revenue growth of 12% to 13% for the fiscal year. Executives are monitoring a potential recession but believe the company has lead time before it impacts their strong brands and grocery categories. Despite a decrease in net income for the second quarter, net operating revenues increased, driven by higher prices and concentrate sales, and unit case volume grew across categories.

title: Coca-Cola’s Recycled Content Pledges Won’t Save the Oceans from Plastic Pollution, Says Oceana Senior Vice President
summary: Oceana states that Coca-Cola's pledges to increase recycled content in its plastic bottles, including Dasani and Sprite, will do little to combat ocean plastic pollution or change its status as the world’s top plastic polluter. The organization argues that recycled content changes neither consumer behavior nor collection rates, leading bottles to still end up in landfills or oceans. Oceana urges Coca-Cola to focus on refillable bottles, as a 10% increase in refillables could prevent billions of single-use plastic bottles from entering the ocean annually and reduce the company's carbon footprint.

title: Coca-Cola increased marketing spend to create brand value amid price hikes
summary: The Coca-Cola Company reported a 12% increase in net revenues to $11.3 billion in Q2 2022, exceeding analyst expectations due to pricing increases and global sales volume growth. To justify price hikes and create brand value, the company increased its marketing spend, focusing on experiential campaigns linking consumption with consumer passions like music and gaming, and leveraging digital-first strategies and cultural activations. Coca-Cola also raised its full-year organic revenue guidance, preparing for a challenging consumer environment by stepping up investments and utilizing data for better consumer reach.

title: Coca-Cola Posts Higher Quarterly Sales Despite Price Increases
summary: Coca-Cola reported strong second-quarter sales and increased its revenue outlook for the year, largely due to consumers returning to events and travel destinations despite rising prices. The beverage company's success comes as inflation continues to climb, pushing consumer price indices to their highest levels in decades. Consumers are demonstrating a willingness to pay more for soda, contributing to Coca-Cola's higher quarterly sales.

title: Coca-Cola sees strong consumer demand despite rising prices
summary: Coca-Cola reported strong financial results for its second quarter, with a 12% rise in net revenue and an 8% increase in global unit case volume, despite rising prices due to inflation. The company raised its top-line guidance for the second half of the year, expecting 12-13% organic revenue growth and 5-6% comparable earnings per share growth, while closely monitoring consumer behavior as costs continue to climb. CFO John Murphy will also assume the role of president in September.

title: Coca-Cola raises revenue forecast as soda demand defies price hikes
summary: Coca-Cola Co raised its full-year revenue forecast due to strong demand for its sugary sodas, despite increased prices intended to offset higher costs. Global sales volumes grew 8% in the second quarter, and the company plans further price hikes in response to rising costs. Net revenue for the quarter exceeded analyst expectations, although operating margins were impacted by higher expenses.

title: The Coca-Cola Company Q2 Profit Decreases, but beats estimates
summary: The Coca-Cola Company reported a decrease in Q2 profit to $1.91 billion, or $0.44 per share, compared to $2.64 billion last year. However, adjusted earnings of $0.70 per share beat analysts' estimates of $0.67 per share. The company's revenue increased by 9.7% to $11.33 billion for the quarter.

title: GALLERY: Coca-Cola mural returns to downtown Panama City
summary: The Panama City Coca-Cola Bottling Company hosted a grand unveiling ceremony for a restored Coca-Cola mural in downtown Panama City on Wednesday, July 20, 2022. Artist Logan Flint, who helped paint the mural, and local personalities like Wes Morgan of Coca-Cola and Pam Armstrong of TomÕs Hot Dogs were present. Jayson Kretzer, Executive Director of the Bay Arts Alliance, was also acknowledged for his support of downtown murals.

title: Swire Coca-Cola to acquire Coca-Cola bottling businesses in Vietnam and Cambodia
summary: Swire Coca-Cola Limited, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Swire Pacific Limited, is set to acquire Coca-Cola bottling businesses in Vietnam and Cambodia. This acquisition marks Swire Coca-Cola's first investment in Southeast Asia, significantly expanding its operating footprint and franchise population to approximately 876 million people. The move capitalizes on the region's dynamic non-alcoholic beverage market, valued at over $6 billion and projected to grow at a CAGR of over 6% until 2036.

title: Carolyn Everson Elected to Board of Directors of The Coca-Cola Company
summary: The Coca-Cola Company announced the election of Carolyn Everson to its Board of Directors. Everson brings extensive experience from leadership roles at Instacart, Facebook (now Meta), Microsoft, and Viacom, where she was involved in global business and sales. Her appointment is expected to provide valuable knowledge and perspective to the company given her background in media and consumer-facing businesses.

title: HK's Swire Pacific buys Coca-Cola bottling operations in Vietnam, Cambodia
summary: Hong Kong-based conglomerate Swire Pacific Ltd announced on Monday its acquisition of Coca-Cola's packaging and distribution operations in Vietnam and Cambodia. This $1.02 billion cash deal marks Swire Pacific's expansion into the Southeast Asian beverages market, purchasing Coca-Cola Indochina through its Swire Beverages and Swire Coca-Cola units.

title: Former Coca-Cola exec joins Lemon Perfect
summary: Former Coca-Cola Co. executive Jim Brennan has joined Lemon Perfect, a flavored lemon water brand, as president and chief revenue officer. Mr. Brennan, who previously served as a board member and strategic adviser, is tasked with scaling the company, which quadrupled its business in 2021 and aims for significant distribution growth. He plans to leverage his three decades of experience to make Lemon Perfect the leading brand in the enhanced water category.

title: Vita Coco launches its first packaged coconut juice in sustainable aluminium cans
summary: Vita Coco has launched its first ready-to-drink coconut juice, packaged in sustainable 16.9-ounce aluminium cans. This new product extends the shelf-life of the juice and leverages aluminium's infinite recyclability for a circular economy. The juice comes in mango and original with pulp flavors, is gluten-free, and non-GMO, marking Vita Coco's entry into the refreshing drinks category.

title: Coca-Cola Beverages Florida Breaks Ground On New Distribution Center At U.S. 301 & Causeway Blvd.
summary: Coca-Cola Beverages Florida, the largest minority-owned business in Florida, has broken ground on an 800,000 sq. ft. complex in Tampa, located at U.S. Highway 301 and Causeway Boulevard. This state-of-the-art facility represents a $250 million investment and will serve as a fully automated fulfillment center and corporate offices. The groundbreaking ceremony was attended by local officials and partners, highlighting the company's significant economic impact and community involvement.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper achieves 11% PCR use
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper increased its post-consumer resin (PCR) use in plastic packaging to 11% in 2021, up from 2% the previous year, primarily by utilizing 100% recycled PET bottles for several brands. This progress keeps the company on track for its goal of 25% PCR use by 2025 and eliminated 57 million pounds of virgin plastic last year. The shift also contributed to a 9% reduction in Scope 1 and 2 greenhouse gas emissions compared to its 2018 baseline.

title: Diageo partners with Vita Coco on canned cocktail beverage
summary: Diageo is collaborating with The Vita Coco Company to launch a new line of premium canned cocktails called Vita Coco Spiked with Captain Morgan. These rum-based cocktails, available in three flavors, will hit the market in early 2023, capitalizing on the rapid growth of the ready-to-drink cocktail category. The partnership leverages both companies' market leadership in their respective sectors to expand their brand reach and offer a differentiated product.

title: Coca-Cola turns up the heat on frozen as it searches for growth
summary: Coca-Cola is increasingly focusing on its frozen beverage offerings as a key growth area, particularly to attract younger consumers (millennials and Gen Z) to its brand portfolio. The company sees frozen drinks as a way to engage new generations before they transition to adult-targeted products like Coke Zero Sugar, as well as to expand consumption occasions and experiment with new flavors and textures. Frozen products also represent a highly profitable category for convenience stores, which serve as a significant testing ground for these innovations.

title: Coca-Cola Continues Digital Experience Drive With Marshmello Tie-up
summary: Coca-Cola is launching a new collaboration with Grammy-nominated music producer Marshmello as part of its Coca-Cola Creations platform. This limited-edition drink will combine Marshmello's favorite flavors, strawberry and watermelon, with the taste of Coca-Cola, and will be packaged in distinct black and white cans. This initiative follows the successful first release, "Intergalactic," and aims to drive digital experiences through collaboration, creativity, and cultural connections.

title: What's the Impact of the Strong Dollar on My Portfolio?
summary: The strong U.S. dollar, experiencing its biggest rally in 20 years, negatively impacts non-U.S. fund returns and profitability for American companies operating overseas. While it offers advantages for consumers traveling abroad, investors in international stocks and bonds face challenges due to unfavorable exchange rates and increased repayment costs for dollar-denominated debt. Despite the difficulties, some Morningstar analysts suggest currency hedging can minimize volatility, and others view the current currency weakness as an attractive buying opportunity for international funds.

title: Coke teams up with Marshmello for limited-edition flavor
summary: Coca-Cola is launching a limited-edition flavor in collaboration with Grammy-nominated artist Marshmello, marking the first time the company has co-created a beverage with an artist. The new strawberry and watermelon flavor will be available in regular and zero-sugar options with distinctive black-and-white cans, supported by a Twitch activation featuring "metamerch." This initiative is part of the Coca-Cola Creations platform, which aims to create unique flavors and position Coca-Cola as a lifestyle brand through merchandise and virtual experiences, while also promoting Marshmello's new song "Numb."

title: Coca-Cola among brands greenwashing over packaging, report says
summary: A report by the Changing Markets Foundation accuses major brands like Coca-Cola and Unilever of "greenwashing" by making misleading claims about the eco-friendliness of their plastic packaging. The report highlights examples of companies promoting packaging as recyclable or made from ocean plastic, while obscuring the true environmental impact or difficulties in actual recycling. It calls for regulators to take these claims seriously and advocates for systemic solutions like deposit return systems and plastic reduction.

title: Dr Pepper Maker Opens 300,000 sq ft Newbridge Manufacturing Plant
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) Ireland has opened a 300,000 sq ft international operations hub in Newbridge, Co Kildare, marking its second manufacturing plant for beverage concentrate and its first outside North America. The facility plans to add 20 jobs by year-end, bringing the total to 100, and will serve as a 'centre of excellence' for concentrate production and global sourcing. This expansion underscores Ireland's reputation as a manufacturing and supply chain hub, as acknowledged by IDA Ireland CEO Martin Shanahan.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper Expands RTD Portfolio With Atypique Addition
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper is set to acquire the rights to Atypique, a non-alcoholic, ready-to-drink cocktail brand, from Station Agro-Biotech. This strategic move aims to expand KDP's RTD portfolio and leverage Station Agro-Biotech's R&D capabilities with KDP’s sales and distribution network. The acquisition highlights the growing global RTD cocktails market, a sector that has seen significant growth and M&A activity.

title: Coca-Cola wants to fill the space between beer and soft drinks
summary: Coca-Cola is strategically entering the flavored alcoholic beverage market to bridge the gap between beer and soft drinks, leveraging products like Topo Chico Hard Seltzer, Simply Mixed, and the newly launched ready-to-drink Jack Daniel’s & Coca-Cola.
