The company sees significant potential in at-home consumption for these offerings, including a zero-sugar option for the Jack and Coke line, and is also accelerating efforts around health and wellness, ESG, convenience, and functionality trends. Manuel Arroyo Prieto, Coca-Cola's chief marketing officer, highlighted the early success and potential of the Jack and Coke product, with global rollout plans beginning in Mexico.

title: Coca-Cola has an ambitious plan to double its number of customers in the next few years
summary: Coca-Cola's global chief marketing officer, Manuel Arroyo, aims to double the company's consumer base by implementing QR codes on all packaging within three years to gather data and enhance marketing efficiency. This goal is supported by a new partnership with WPP, dubbed OpenX, which seeks to create a single, consistent global marketing strategy, moving away from fragmented approaches. The partnership emphasizes shared metrics with WPP, linking compensation to the growth of Coca-Cola's consumer base.

title: smartwater Announces Zendaya as Newest Global Brand Ambassador
summary: smartwater has announced Zendaya as its newest global brand ambassador to launch a campaign that celebrates defining 'smart' on one's own terms. As part of this partnership, Zendaya will also collaborate with smartwater and the Global Water Challenge to support community water quality and access improvements, starting with her hometown of Oakland, California. This initiative builds on The Coca-Cola Company's long-standing investments in clean water access globally.

title: Why the Jack Daniel’s Coca-Cola tie-up could be a game-changer
summary: The collaboration between Brown-Forman and The Coca-Cola Co. to launch a co-branded Jack Daniel’s and Coca-Cola premixed drink is anticipated to be a significant market disruptor. This venture, starting in Mexico, represents a major step for Coca-Cola into alcoholic beverages and offers substantial benefits to both companies, particularly in expanding Jack Daniel's market penetration and leveraging Coca-Cola's global distribution. The article also prompts the broader spirits industry, especially Scotch brands, to consider similar RTD innovations to remain relevant with younger consumers.

title: Some Publicly Traded Bourbon Companies, in Honor of National Bourbon Day
summary: This article discusses publicly traded companies that offer exposure to the bourbon and broader alcohol market, despite most bourbon companies being privately owned. It highlights Brown-Forman (BF.B) as a key player with major bourbon brands and mentions other alcohol companies and ETFs like Invesco Dynamic Food and Beverage ETF (PBJ) for investment consideration. The piece also touches on general alcohol industry investments beyond bourbon.

title: Brown-Forman and The Coca-Cola Company Announce Plans to Debut Jack Daniel’s® Tennessee Whiskey and Coca-Cola®™ Ready-to-Drink Cocktail
summary: Brown-Forman and The Coca-Cola Company announced a global partnership to launch a ready-to-drink (RTD) Jack & Coke cocktail, made with Jack Daniel’s Tennessee Whiskey and Coca-Cola. The pre-mixed beverage will debut in Mexico in late 2022 and will be available globally, with a zero-sugar option also planned. This collaboration brings together two iconic American brands to offer consumers a convenient and portable version of the classic bar drink.

title: PepsiCo commits to new sustainable packaging goal
summary: PepsiCo, Inc. has announced a new goal to increase the percentage of its beverages sold through reusable models from 10% to 20% by 2030, reinforcing its prior commitment to reduce single-use virgin plastic. This initiative, part of its pep+ sustainability program, will be supported by a four-pronged approach including expanding its SodaStream business, increasing refillable bottle offerings, investing in concentrates, and developing fountain drink options. The company's efforts align with a broader industry trend toward sustainable packaging, moving towards a circular economy model.

title: A Deeper Look at Coca‑Cola’s Emerging Business in Alcohol
summary: Coca-Cola is expanding its presence in the alcohol beverage market, which began with Lemon-Dou in Japan in 2018. The company is strategically experimenting with flavored alcohol beverages (FABs), including hard seltzers, hard alternatives, and pre-mixed cocktails, using a disciplined and responsible approach. Coca-Cola emphasizes consumer focus, offering more choices in this rapidly expanding segment, and is committed to promoting responsible consumption through a comprehensive Policy on Alcohol Responsibility.

title: Russian-owned successor of McDonald’s opens in Moscow
summary: After McDonald's exited Russia due to the conflict in Ukraine, its former restaurants reopened under Russian ownership and a new name, Vkusno-i Tochka (Tasty-period), in Moscow. The new chain aims to fill the void left by McDonald's, retaining staff and mimicking the original restaurant's layout, though potentially seeking new suppliers for certain products like soft drinks. The reopening drew crowds, albeit smaller than McDonald's initial 1990 debut, and resonated with a sense of nostalgia for Western consumerism.

title: Accenture joins the TOUR Championship as a Proud Partner
summary: Accenture has joined the TOUR Championship as a Proud Partner, an agreement extending through 2027. This partnership aims to elevate the FedExCup Playoffs finale at East Lake Golf Club and enhance its positive impact on the Atlanta community. Accenture will also make an annual contribution to First Tee, supporting youth development.

title: Legg Mason Low Volatility High Dividend ETF (LVHD) Pays Off
summary: The Legg Mason Low Volatility High Dividend ETF (LVHD) has demonstrated resilience amidst market turbulence, outperforming the S&P 500 Index with a 2.2% loss year-to-date compared to the S&P 500's 13.1% decline. The fund focuses on high-quality companies with strong dividend yields, steady profits, and low share-price volatility, favoring sectors like utilities, consumer staples, and real estate, and boasts a 3.06% dividend yield. While it lagged the S&P 500 in 2020 due to its focus on established companies over high-growth stocks, it proved 5% less volatile over a three-year period.

title: Colgate-Palmolive: Stability Amid Volatility
summary: This article argues that Colgate-Palmolive (CL) offers favorable risk/reward for investors due to its strong global brand, distribution network, and consistent free cash flow, despite recent underperformance. The analysis highlights the company's profitability compared to competitors and growth in its pet nutrition segment, projecting a significant upside for the stock. While acknowledging challenges like lagging sales in North America and Europe, falling margins, and private label growth, the article concludes that the stock is undervalued based on its discounted cash flow model.

title: Boston Beer Co. Launches TeaPot, Cannabis-Infused Iced Tea
summary: Boston Beer Company, known for Samuel Adams, is entering the cannabis market with "TeaPot," a THC-infused iced tea, launching in Canada in July. This move marks one of the first major alcohol companies to launch its own THC brand, with plans for eventual U.S. market entry despite federal marijuana prohibition. The company aims to attract new consumers with cannabis beverages, seeing it as a more socially acceptable form of consumption than other cannabis products.

title: Conagra Brands Showcases Stellar Snacks Line-up at 2022 Sweets & Snacks Expo
summary: Conagra Brands showcased its $2.9 billion snacking portfolio, featuring iconic and emerging brands, at the 2022 Sweets & Snacks Expo in Chicago. The company highlighted new innovations from brands like Slim Jim, DAVID and BiGS Sunflower Seeds, ACT II, Angie's BOOMCHICKAPOP, Andy Capp's, and Snack Pack, along with merchandising solutions. This presentation aimed to connect with customers and emphasize the strength and variety of their snack offerings across various categories.

title: Jumia releases reports of 2022 first quarter
summary: Jumia Technologies AG announced strong financial results for the first quarter of 2022, showcasing significant growth in GMV, orders, and revenue, reaching nine-quarter highs. The company emphasized its path to profitability through accelerated usage growth, improved marketing efficiency, and continued execution of its growth strategy. Jumia also highlighted its progress in monetizing logistics services for third parties and strong growth in its advertising campaigns, securing its position as a leading brand in the Egyptian market.

title: Beer Insights Conference: A-B Focuses Beyond Beer on Hard Seltzer, RTDs; Mergers and Acquisitions Expected to Ramp Up
summary: Anheuser-Busch InBev is prioritizing hard seltzers, Cutwater Spirits, Nütrl Vodka Seltzer, and Ghost Energy in its beyond beer division, even as Bud Light Seltzer sales decline. The company is adapting to the consumer shift from sugar/malt-based seltzers to spirits-based RTDs, with Cutwater being a strong performer. The article also anticipates an increase in mergers and acquisitions in the beverage industry, driven by market maturation and premiumization, and highlights DEI initiatives by Constellation Brands and Diageo.

title: The Coca-Cola Co, Coca-Cola Europacific Partners roll out tethered bottle cap in UK
summary: The Coca-Cola Co and Coca-Cola Europacific Partners have begun rolling out tethered bottle caps across the UK, starting with an initial launch in Scotland. This redesign aims to keep the cap attached to plastic bottles after opening. The move is part of an initiative to improve recycling and reduce litter.

title: University of Arkansas nears deal for return of Coca-Cola
summary: The University of Arkansas is finalizing a 10-year deal to bring Coca-Cola back as its exclusive beverage provider, replacing PepsiCo whose $19 million contract expires on June 30. This new agreement, effective July 1, will offer diverse Coca-Cola products on campus and at events, alongside providing internship opportunities and scholarship funding for students. The total financial value of the new contract will be disclosed after final negotiations are complete.

title: Coca-Cola Company
summary: This article provides a brief overview of The Coca-Cola Company. It highlights the company's global presence and its primary business as a beverage company focusing on the manufacture, retail, and marketing of non-alcoholic beverage concentrates and syrups.

title: Rhodes College to Award Honorary Degree to Retired Coca-Cola Enterprises Executive Vicki R. Palmer
summary: Rhodes College will award an honorary Doctor of Humanities degree to Vicki R. Palmer ’75, a retired executive from Coca-Cola Enterprises Inc., at its 173rd Commencement. Palmer, a financial expert and community leader, had a distinguished career including roles at First Tennessee Bank, FedEx, and Coca-Cola, and has been a significant benefactor and alumna of Rhodes College. She will be honored for her accomplishments and contributions during the ceremony on May 14.

title: US Sentences Chemist for Theft of Coca-Cola Secrets Worth $120 Million
summary: A former Coca-Cola chemist, Xiaorong You, has been sentenced to 14 years in prison for stealing trade secrets related to BPA-free coatings for soda cans, valued at nearly $120 million. She stole these secrets to benefit a Chinese company, Weihai Jinhong Group, and the Chinese government. The judgment also includes three years of supervised release and $200,000 in damages.
source: Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project | OCCRP
source_domain: Organized Crime and Corruption Reporting Project | OCCRP

title: Chemist sentenced to 14 years for stealing Eastman, other companies’ trade secrets
summary: A chemist, Xiaorong You (aka Shannon You), has been sentenced to 14 years in prison for stealing trade secrets from Eastman Chemical Company and several other companies. These trade secrets, valued at nearly $120 million, were related to BPA-free can coatings, which You intended to use for a can-coating manufacturer in China, supported by Chinese government grants. She was convicted of multiple charges including conspiracy to commit trade secret theft and economic espionage after gaining access to the information while working at Coca-Cola and Eastman.

title: Molson Coors to Release Simply Spiked Lemonade in June
summary: Molson Coors Beverage Company announced that its new Simply Spiked Lemonade line, inspired by The Coca-Cola Company's Simply juice brand, will launch in June. This product marks the latest collaboration between the two companies, following the success of Topo Chico Hard Seltzer. Simply Spiked Lemonade will be available in four distinct flavors and is expected to capitalize on significant consumer hype.

title: Kraft Heinz wants to solve its supply chain problems — in the metaverse
summary: Kraft Heinz is leveraging the metaverse and a partnership with Microsoft to enhance its supply chain efficiency. By creating "digital twins" of its facilities, the company aims to resolve logistical issues virtually, speed up operations, and ensure products like Lunchables and Velveeta reach shelves faster. This technological investment seeks to improve dependability and responsiveness to shifting consumer demands.

title: Industrial Sugar Market to Reach USD 46.56 Billion by 2029
summary: The global industrial sugar market is projected to reach USD 46.56 billion by 2029, growing at a CAGR of 2.72% from USD 38.58 billion in 2022. The market, which was valued at USD 37.62 billion in 2021, saw a decline in demand during the COVID-19 pandemic. Key drivers include increasing utilization in processed foods and beverages, and strong demand for sugar confectioneries, particularly in the Asia Pacific region.

title: These Atlanta CEOs make 1,000 times their typical employees
summary: CEOs at major Atlanta companies like Coca-Cola, Carter's, and Fleetcor Technologies earn salaries that are 1,000 times higher than their typical employees. The article highlights the CEO-to-worker pay ratio at 40 of Georgia's largest public companies, including UPS, Aflac, and Delta Air Lines. This report was published by the Atlanta Business Chronicle.

title: Conagra Brands Names Lucy Brady President of Grocery and Snacks
summary: Conagra Brands has appointed Lucy Brady as President of Grocery and Snacks, effective June 15. Brady will be responsible for modernizing the company and growing its grocery and snack portfolio, which includes brands like Slim Jim and Duncan Hines. She brings extensive experience from previous roles at McDonald’s and Boston Consulting Group, where she focused on digital customer engagement, strategy, and business development.

title: Nike Inc. hires new Jordan brand CMO Shannon Watkins, from Aflac, Coca Cola - Bizwomen
summary: Nike Inc. has appointed Shannon Watkins, formerly of Aflac and Coca-Cola, as the new Chief Marketing Officer for its Jordan brand. Her hiring is part of Nike's broader strategy to enhance its direct-to-consumer and digital sales efforts, coinciding with other recent executive hires and changes to the company's return-to-office policy. Watkins received an AdWeek award in 2021 for her work on a collaboration focusing on inequities in HBCUs.

title: PepsiCo says revenues jumped after it raised prices. (Published 2022)
summary: PepsiCo reported strong first-quarter revenues primarily driven by price increases across its snack and beverage brands, despite modest volume growth. The company saw revenues rise 9.3 percent to $16.2 billion, with its Frito-Lay North American division experiencing a 12 percent pricing soar. Executives acknowledged consumers facing inflation and aim to monitor behavior closely for future pricing decisions while emphasizing the company's historical resilience during inflationary periods.

title: The Untold Truth Of Yum Brands
summary: Yum Brands, parent company of KFC, Pizza Hut, and Taco Bell, originated from PepsiCo's restaurant division before becoming an independent entity in 1997. The company has a history of acquiring and divesting various restaurant chains, expanding significantly in China, and has faced past controversies regarding food safety. Despite challenges, Yum Brands is a major global restaurant company, known for its philanthropic efforts and commitment to sustainability.

title: Energy drink A Shoc raises $29M from investors including Keurig Dr Pepper
summary: A Shoc, an energy drink distributed by Keurig Dr Pepper, raised $29 million in a Series B funding round with investors including Keurig Dr Pepper, Aaron Judge, Freddie Freeman, and Michael Strahan. The company, founded by Lance Collins, is positioned in the fast-growing U.S. energy drink market and has a "path to ownership deal" with Keurig Dr Pepper. Given Collins' track record of building and selling successful brands to large corporations like Coca-Cola and Keurig Dr Pepper, a full acquisition by Keurig Dr Pepper is a strong possibility as it seeks to compete with Monster and Rockstar.

title: Mars invites Mondelēz International, Nestlé and General Mills into key climate action group
summary: Mars, in partnership with Guidehouse, PepsiCo, and McCormick & Company, has invited nine major global brands, including Mondelēz International, Nestlé, and General Mills, to join the Supplier Leadership on Climate Transition (Supplier LoCT) consortium. This initiative aims to drive action towards achieving net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050, focusing on engaging and mobilizing suppliers to reduce Scope 3 emissions. The consortium offers instructional seminars and direct mentoring to help suppliers build internal capacity for climate action.

title: Hasbro plans to further hike prices of toys, warns of $100 million Russia hit
summary: Hasbro Inc. announced plans to increase toy prices further to offset soaring costs and projected a potential $100 million revenue hit this year due to pausing shipments to Russia. The company also lifted its fiscal 2022 operating profit growth forecast and reported a 4% rise in net revenue, though adjusted first-quarter earnings per share missed estimates. These measures are intended to mitigate supply issues and improve product availability for the holiday season.

title: Femsa firma acuerdo para comprar Sigma Supply en Estados Unidos
summary: Femsa, through its subsidiary Envoy Solutions, has agreed to acquire Sigma Supply of North America to strengthen its distribution business in the United States. This acquisition will expand Envoy's presence into Texas and bolster its reach in the South and Mid-Atlantic regions, adding significant capabilities in packaging materials, solutions, and services. The deal, which enhances Femsa's national distribution platform strategy, is expected to close in the second quarter of 2022 and adds to the over $1.7 billion in annual revenue from previously acquired companies in this sector.

title: Williams Sonoma Partners with the Kentucky Derby® to Inspire At-Home Race Day Celebrations
summary: Williams Sonoma has partnered with the Kentucky Derby and Woodford Reserve to inspire at-home race day celebrations for the 148th Kentucky Derby. This partnership includes a curated line of merchandise, co-branded cocktail mixes, special recipes from Chef Kelsey Barnard Clark, and virtual and in-person cooking events. The collaboration aims to bring the authentic charm of the Derby into homes and offers a sweepstakes for a trip to the 149th Kentucky Derby in 2023.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper CEO to step down in July
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper CEO and Chairman Bob Gamgort will step down on July 29, to be succeeded by CFO and international division president Ozan Dokmecioglu. Gamgort will transition to executive chairman for two years, working closely with Dokmecioglu who will lead the company's operational strategy. This leadership change comes after Gamgort successfully integrated the merged companies and grew sales, while Dokmecioglu is an insider familiar with the company's finances and strategy.

title: Facing production constraints, Hershey turns to SKU rationalization
summary: Hershey is addressing omicron-induced production challenges by rationalizing SKUs, focusing on its most popular products to free up capacity and reduce complexity. This strategy, previously used by other food and beverage makers during the pandemic, helps maintain operational efficiency amidst rising inflation, labor shortages, and supply chain constraints. Despite offering less variety, the company has seen increased shelf space and minimal negative impact from these choices.

title: Coca-Cola FEMSA lanzó su Informe Anual Integrado
summary: Coca-Cola FEMSA (KOF) released its 2021 Integrated Annual Report, "Re-Evolución," highlighting its operational, financial, and non-financial achievements driven by its strategic framework and purpose. The report emphasizes the company's resilience, adaptability, and agility, showcasing positive results across strategic fronts, from portfolio management and digital transformation to sustainable development. Key achievements include significant financial growth, expansion of its omni-channel platform, sustainable financing for green projects, and notable progress in circular economy, water management, and climate action initiatives.

title: Coca-Cola CMO on Building Consumer Loyalty, Trust
summary: Melanie Boulden, CMO of Coca-Cola North America, discusses strategies for building consumer loyalty and trust in a competitive and evolving market. She highlights three key priorities: recruiting the next generation of consumers, adapting to shifts in marketplace dynamics like online purchasing, and establishing a new marketing organization following a major company reorganization. The article emphasizes the importance of listening to consumers, delivering on promises, and evolving marketing efforts to stay culturally relevant and transparent.

title: Making a Difference Through the Energize Learning Project: An Interview with AIM-Progress Africa Hub
summary: This article details The Hershey Company's "Energize Learning" project in Côte d’Ivoire and Ghana, which provides vitamin-fortified peanut butter snacks ("ViVi") to schoolchildren. The initiative aims to improve nutrition, combat child labor by incentivizing school attendance, and strengthen local agri-food systems by sourcing ingredients locally. The project, in partnership with Project Peanut Butter and local governments, currently reaches over 45,000 children daily.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper makes sustainability push with new water goal and packaging prototype
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper announced a new goal to be net water positive by 2050 and plans to test its first fully recyclable and compostable paper bottle later this year. This initiative is part of an industry-wide trend where CPGs are improving sustainability through water reduction and recyclable packaging to mitigate their environmental footprint. The company's new paper bottle will be 100% plastic-free and curbside recyclable, aligning with its aim to cut virgin plastic packaging usage by 20% by 2025.

title: Consumer Staples: 5 Things To Know About This Defensive Sector
summary: This article provides an overview of consumer staples stocks, highlighting their defensive nature, consistent dividend payments, and potential drawbacks like modest growth and susceptibility to inflation. It categorizes consumer staples into five subcategories and explains how investors can gain exposure through individual stocks or ETFs. The piece emphasizes their stability during market volatility and their role as a cushion for investor portfolios.

title: Coca-Cola partners Diginex for ESG supply chain traceability using blockchain
summary: Coca-Cola and Reckitt have partnered with Diginex to launch diginexLUMEN, a blockchain-based ESG supply chain traceability tool. This solution aims to enhance transparency and promote due diligence regarding working conditions in global supply chains, addressing critical issues like child and forced labor. The ongoing monitoring and blockchain technology are intended to improve human rights for workers.

title: Colgate-Palmolive to sell only essential health, hygiene products in Russia
summary: Colgate-Palmolive announced that it will only sell essential health and hygiene products in Russia, ceasing all other product imports, capital investments, media, advertising, and promotional activities in response to the invasion of Ukraine. This decision follows similar actions by other major US companies like PepsiCo, Coca-Cola, McDonald's, Starbucks, Mastercard, and Visa, all suspending or limiting operations in Russia. The company stated it would continue to assess the situation to align with its values.

title: This Memphis company made huge investments in Russia. Now it could face backlash.
summary: Memphis-based International Paper, which made significant investments in a Russian joint venture called Ilim Group, is facing potential financial hits and reputational risks due to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The company is exploring strategic options, including the possible sale of its 50% stake in Ilim Group, after calls from Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy for all American companies to leave Russia. Analysts suggest that despite its deep ties, including a $1.2 billion investment in Russia by 2013, International Paper will likely exit the country, possibly at a financial loss.

title: Pharma major Dr. Reddy's plans 'business continuity' in Russia
summary: Pharmaceutical major Dr. Reddy's Laboratories Ltd announced its commitment to employee safety and business continuity in Russia, despite many Western companies withdrawing from the region. The company stated it has had a presence in Russia for over three decades and will continue to monitor developments closely without confirming changes to its investments. Russia accounted for over 8% of its total sales of $2.47 billion in the last fiscal year.

title: The Coca-Cola Company Suspends its Business in Russia | Press Release
summary: The Coca-Cola Company announced on March 8, 2022, that it is suspending its business operations in Russia. The company expressed solidarity with the people affected by the events in Ukraine and stated it would continue to monitor the evolving situation. The press release also provided background information about The Coca-Cola Company, including its global presence and brand portfolio.

title: Cola Out Of Space: The Coca-Cola Starlight Taste Test
summary: This article reviews Coca-Cola's limited edition Starlight cola, describing its unusual red color, cotton candy-like scent, and refreshing taste without an aftertaste. The author suggests it doesn't taste like traditional Coke and even makes an A+ cocktail when mixed with white rum and a twist of lime, highlighting its unique flavor profile. The review concludes with an amusing note about avoiding late-night taste tests for better sleep.

title: Embotelladora Andina aumenta sus ganancias y refuerza su apuesta por el canal online
summary: Embotelladora Andina reported significant growth in 2021, with utilities increasing by 26.8% to $154,698 million compared to 2020. The company also saw its consolidated net sales rise by 30.5% for the year, reaching $2,216,733 million. A key driver of this growth was the substantial increase in online sales to consumers in Chile, which grew by 65%.

title: Pese a un segundo semestre “desafiante”, Embotelladora Andina apuesta a que en Chile se verá un crecimiento en los volúmenes
summary: Embotelladora Andina, which distributes Coca-Cola in Chile, Argentina, Brazil, and Paraguay, reported significant profit growth and record EBITDA in 2021. Despite anticipating a challenging second semester in Chile due to reduced state aid, the company expects overall volume growth for the year and is successfully passing on increased costs to maintain margins. Coca-Cola Andina is also focused on digital transformation, implementing solutions like KOBoss and expanding its online sales channels.

title: CIAA Reaches Multi-Year Agreement with Coca-Cola to Renew Corporate Partnership
summary: The Central Intercollegiate Athletic Association (CIAA) has extended its corporate partnership with The Coca-Cola Company, continuing a relationship that has spanned over 50 years. This multi-year agreement designates Coca-Cola as the official beverage partner and ensures ongoing support for CIAA championships, member institutions, student-athletes through scholarships, and career opportunities. The partnership reinforces Coca-Cola's commitment to HBCUs and the community within Black college sports.

title: Coke Announces Industry-Leading Target for Reusable Packaging
summary: The Coca-Cola Company has set an ambitious goal to have at least 25% of its beverages sold in refillable or returnable packaging by 2030, a move aimed at reducing waste, conserving resources, and lowering its carbon footprint. This initiative is part of their broader "World Without Waste" program and builds on their existing success with reusable packaging in many markets globally. The company plans significant investments to achieve this target, including expanding innovative solutions like the "Universal Bottle" and partnering on circular shopping systems.

title: Coca-Cola Consolidated acquires North Carolina distribution rights
summary: Coca-Cola Consolidated, Inc. has acquired distribution rights for various beverages in North Carolina from Coca-Cola Bottling Company Washington NC Inc. This includes trademark brands of The Coca-Cola Co. and its partners, such as Monster Energy Drinks, BodyArmor sports drinks, and certain Dr Pepper products.

title: NAPA Upgrades Its Know How, Adding New Agencies And Execs.
summary: NAPA Auto Parts has revamped its agency roster, appointing The Variable for brand strategy, creative, and social, Merkle for CRM, and Golin as its first public relations agency. These changes follow reviews initiated in October and are accompanied by promotions within NAPA's senior marketing team, including Jamie Walton to Executive VP, Chief Merchandising Officer, and Marti Walsh to VP, Marketing. The new partnerships aim to enhance NAPA's brand strategy, customer loyalty programs, and earned media engagement, with a new integrated creative campaign expected in the third quarter.

title: Country’s largest Coca-Cola bottler acquires distribution rights from Washington company
summary: Coca-Cola Consolidated, Inc., the largest Coca-Cola bottler in the U.S., has acquired the distribution rights for certain beverages from Coca-Cola Bottling Company Washington, N.C., Inc. This acquisition, effective January 1, 2022, includes trademark brands from The Coca-Cola Company, Monster Energy, BODYARMOR, and some Dr. Pepper products. The Washington Coca-Cola company, which has been family-owned since 1956, expressed honor in Coke Consolidated continuing its legacy of service.

title: The Coca-Cola Company
summary: The Coca-Cola Company, a strategic partner of the Ellen MacArthur Foundation, is committed to circular economy principles with a focus on sustainable packaging and a regenerative food system. They aim to have 25% of beverages sold through reuse models by 2030 and have implemented innovations like the "universal bottle" to scale returnable packaging across various markets. The company also links ESG performance, including diversity and inclusion, to executive incentives.

title: Colgate-Palmolive Streamlining Supply Chain, Boosting Ad Spend
summary: Colgate-Palmolive is implementing a global productivity program to streamline its supply chain and operations, anticipating significant pre-tax savings. The company is also increasing advertising spend across key categories like oral care and pet nutrition and investing in capacity to sustain volume growth amid price increases. Additionally, Colgate is launching a predictive tool for dentists to support its teeth-whitening product.

title: ESG Risk Management Makes Sense, but ESG Impact Is Less Straightforward
summary: This article distinguishes between ESG risk management and ESG impact, arguing that while managing ESG risks directly affects valuation, measuring and achieving positive ESG impact is far more complex and less directly tied to financial returns. It highlights challenges companies like Unilever face when prioritizing sustainability impact at the expense of core business fundamentals, and discusses the difficulty in objectively measuring the benefits of impact spending and aligning diverse investor values.

title: The 10 Best Consumer Cyclical Stocks to Buy for 2022
summary: This article identifies the top 10 consumer cyclical stocks to consider buying in 2022, based on the expectation of robust economic growth and strong consumer confidence. It highlights companies in recreation, retail, household durables, automotive, and media sectors, detailing their recent financial performance, stock movements, and market outlook. The list includes companies like Chewy, Coca-Cola, Costco, Ford, Home Depot, Nike, and Royal Caribbean, along with two relevant ETFs.

title: Monster Beverage to enter alcohol market with craft beer
summary: Monster Beverage Corp is venturing into the alcoholic drinks market through a US$330 million acquisition of CANarchy Craft Brewery Collective LLC. This move allows Monster, known for its energy drinks, to gain infrastructure, distribution, and expertise in the alcoholic beverage industry. The deal, expected to close in the first quarter of the year, reflects a trend of soft-drink companies expanding into alcohol.

title: Your Favorite Craft Beer May Now Be Owned By Monster Beverage
summary: Monster Beverage Corp has acquired CANarchy Craft Brewery Collective in a $330 million deal, marking its entry into the alcoholic beverage market. This move allows Monster to leverage established craft beer and hard seltzer brands like Oskar Blues and Cigar City, rather than creating new ones from scratch. The energy drink company plans for Monster and CANarchy to operate independently, with potential future Monster-branded alcoholic beverages.

title: Monster Energy Acquires CANarchy for $330M, Entering the Alcohol Industry
summary: Monster Beverage Corp. has announced its acquisition of craft beer and hard seltzer producer CANarchy Brewery Collective, LLC for $330 million, marking its official entry into the alcoholic beverage industry. This move follows a trend of soft beverage companies expanding into alcohol, much like Coca-Cola and PepsiCo. The acquisition is expected to close before the end of the first quarter and provides Monster with an established infrastructure for alcoholic beverage development and distribution.

title: New Mutation — Monster Energy Finds National Alcohol Foothold in CANarchy Acquisition
summary: Monster Beverage Corporation is acquiring CANarchy Craft Brewery Collective LLC for $330 million in cash, marking Monster's entry into the alcohol market. This deal provides Monster with a national alcohol distribution network and production capabilities, while Fireman Capital Partners, CANarchy's owner, secures a return on investment amidst a challenging sales market for craft beer. The acquisition is seen as a strategic move for Monster to diversify its portfolio, potentially moving away from a rumored merger with Constellation Brands.

title: Monster Energy enters alcohol with $330M purchase of Canarchy Craft Brewery
summary: Monster Beverage is set to acquire Canarchy Craft Brewery Collective for $330 million, marking its entry into the alcoholic beverage market. This strategic move provides Monster with an established infrastructure and brands like Cigar City and Oskar Blues, allowing it to diversify beyond energy drinks and compete with industry giants. The acquisition comes amidst rumors of Monster itself being an acquisition target, suggesting a push towards independence and new growth avenues.

title: Monster acquires CANarchy, which includes Cigar City & Oskar Blues
summary: Monster Beverage Corp, known for Monster Energy Drinks, has acquired CANarchy, a craft beer collective that includes Oskar Blues and Cigar City Brewing, in a $330 million all-cash deal. This acquisition grants Monster access to an established craft brewing infrastructure and distribution channels, ahead of its planned entry into the alcoholic beverage industry with new products and hard seltzers. The Brewers Association has stated that CANarchy will retain its "craft brewer" definition under Monster's ownership, as Monster is not currently a beverage alcohol industry member.

title: Monster Beverage to buy craft-beer maker in alcohol market drive
summary: Monster Beverage Corp is entering the alcoholic drinks market by acquiring CANarchy Craft Brewery Collective LLC for $330 million. This all-cash deal signifies a broader trend of soft-drink companies expanding into the alcohol sector, providing Monster with established infrastructure and expertise in the industry. The acquisition adds several craft beer brands to Monster's portfolio and is expected to close in the first quarter of this year.

title: Coca-Cola Burj Khalifa Advertising | Coca-Cola Middle East
summary: The Coca‑Cola Company unveiled its new global philosophy, "Real Magic," with a spectacular light show on the Burj Khalifa in Dubai. The event celebrated human connection and showcased moments that unite and uplift people. This philosophy, along with a refreshed visual identity, emphasizes finding magic in unexpected everyday moments and the value of diversity.

title: Monster Beverage Is Making A Huge Move Into The Alcohol Sector With The Purchase Of CANarchy
summary: Monster Beverage (MNST) has acquired CANarchy Craft Brewery Collective for $330 million, officially entering the alcohol beverage market. This acquisition provides Monster with established distribution networks and existing infrastructure to launch new alcoholic products. The deal comes as the hard seltzer market continues to grow and other beverage companies are merging into the alcohol sector.

title: New Report Shows Continued Growth in Hard Seltzer Market
summary: A new report projects the global hard seltzer market to reach USD 49.4 billion by 2028, growing at a CAGR of 31.4% from 2021 to 2028. This growth is driven by shifting consumer preferences for low-alcohol, low-calorie

title: Constellation Brands, Coca-Cola enter agreement for FRESCA brand
summary: Constellation Brands and The Coca-Cola Co. have announced a brand authorization agreement in the U.S. to launch FRESCA Mixed, a new line of spirit-based, ready-to-drink (RTD) cocktails. This collaboration aims to leverage the growing adult alternative beverage market, with FRESCA Mixed products expected to hit the market later this year. The initiative builds on FRESCA's rising popularity as a mixer and a sparkling soda, using Constellation's expertise in beverage alcohol.

title: Constellation Brands Grows Shipments +3%, Depletions +8% in Q3; Brewery Expansions to Add 20+ Million Barrels of Capacity
summary: Constellation Brands reported strong Q3 results for its beer business, with shipments up 3.1% and depletions up 8.4%. The company plans significant brewery expansions in Mexico, investing up to $5.5 billion to add over 20 million barrels of capacity, aiming for 7-9% top-line growth in beer. Despite margin declines due to increased costs, Constellation expects to implement price increases and is launching a new spirits-based canned cocktail, Fresca Mixed, through its wholesaler network.

title: Coca-Cola, Constellation Brands strike deal to offer Fresca canned cocktails
summary: Coca-Cola is partnering with Constellation Brands to launch a new line of spirit-based, ready-to-drink canned cocktails under its Fresca brand, called Fresca Mixed, which is expected to debut later this year. This collaboration follows similar moves by other beverage giants into the adult alternative beverage market, a rapidly growing segment. The financial terms of the deal were not disclosed, and Constellation Brands will be responsible for production, marketing, and distribution.

title: More than words
summary: Plastic packaging producers worldwide are increasing investments to close the loop on their products, acknowledging the historically low recycling rates for plastic compared to other materials. These investments span various forms, from traditional scrap collection and processing to advanced recycling technologies, driven by regulatory pressure, corporate sustainability goals, and shareholder activism. The article highlights major players like Alpla Group, Amcor, Sealed Air Corp., Ineos Styrolution, and PureCycle Technologies, emphasizing efforts in PET, HDPE, and PP, and discussing the debate around the economic viability and environmental impact of chemical recycling.

title: Southern Railway Serves the South
summary: The Atlanta History Center received a significant collection of railroad archival materials from Norfolk Southern Corporation, including corporate records from Southern Railway and over 200 forerunner companies, and a $500,000 donation for archiving and digitization. The collection highlights Southern Railway's pivotal role in developing the South, its technological innovations, and its impact on Atlanta as a major transportation hub. These newly acquired archives will help tell the story of the many people and businesses connected to the railroads.

title: Mercado de cerveza de Chile enfrenta alta competencia
summary: The Chilean beer market is highly competitive, featuring a wide range of local and imported beers, with CCU's main competitor being Cervecería Chile, a subsidiary of Ambev S.A. Other key players include Viña Concha y Toro SA and Cooperativa Agrícola Pisquera Elqui Limitada (Capel), which import international brands and produce craft beer. The article also touches upon the competition in the non-alcoholic beverages segment, where CCU faces off against licensees of The Coca-Cola Company.

title: Herbert A. Allen III Elected to Board of Directors of The Coca-Cola Company
summary: Herbert A. Allen III, president of Allen & Co. LLC, has been elected to the Board of Directors of The Coca-Cola Company, effective December 17, 2021. Allen brings deep knowledge and valuable perspective from his nearly two decades leading Allen & Co., a privately held investment firm focused on media, entertainment, and technology. His father, Herbert A. Allen Jr., retired from the Coca-Cola board earlier in the year after 39 years of service.

title: Herbert A. Allen III Elected to Board of Directors of The Coca-Cola Company
summary: Herbert A. Allen III, president of Allen & Co. LLC, has been elected to The Coca-Cola Company's board of directors, effective December 17, 2021. Allen, 54, follows his father, Herbert A. Allen Jr., who retired after 39 years on the board. His appointment expands the Coca-Cola board to 12 directors.

title: Activist Investing Today: R5’s Mushkin Talks Dollar Tree, Hain
summary: Scott Mushkin of R5 Capital discusses Mantle Ridge's activism at Dollar Tree, comparing its new pricing strategy to Coca-Cola's "New Coke" failure due to potential brand dilution. He also addresses Hain Celestial's M&A strategy, suggesting a sale to a large packaged foods company is unlikely in the near future despite potential receptiveness to reasonable offers. Mushkin emphasizes Dollar Tree's underperformance relative to competitors and the S&P 500, indicating Mantle Ridge's potential success.

title: Merger rumour: Monster and Constellation to create total beverage firm
summary: A merger rumor suggests that Monster Beverage and Constellation Brands are exploring a deal to create a "total beverage company" encompassing energy drinks, spirits, beer, RTDs, and potentially cannabis. This potential megadeal would be one of the largest in the beverage industry, though Coca-Cola's stake in Monster and investor skepticism pose complexities. The concept aims to energize beverage giants to find new ways to engage consumers.

title: Kraft Heinz Hires Abbott Exec to Lead R&D
summary: The Kraft Heinz Co. has appointed Robert Scott as president of research & development – North America, effective Dec. 8, as the company prepares to combine its U.S. and Canada businesses. Scott, formerly of Abbott Nutrition and The Coca-Cola Co., will lead R&D for Kraft Heinz's core business, renovation, innovation, and commercialization strategy. This move aims to advance Kraft Heinz's North America portfolio strategy with a focus on sustainable solutions.

title: Coca-Cola and others report using more recycled plastic
summary: Major packaged goods companies, including Coca-Cola, PepsiCo, and Unilever, reported increased use of post-consumer recycled (PCR) plastic in 2020, according to a report by the Ellen MacArthur Foundation. While these companies are making progress toward their 2025 targets, many still have significant ground to cover. Greenpeace, however, criticized the focus on recycled content, arguing that it does not solve the fundamental problem of plastic pollution and encourages continued fossil fuel-based plastic production.

title: 20-Year Returns: Monster Eats Apple for Breakfast
summary: Over the past 20 years, Monster Beverage Corporation's stock has outperformed major tech companies like Apple and Amazon, increasing by over 100,000 percent. The company, an early entrant in the energy drink market, has grown significantly, recording $1.4 billion in profit on $4.6 billion in sales in 2020. Monster Beverage is now a dominant player in the energy drink market and has recently been in merger talks with Constellation Brands.

title: Energy drinks maker Monster Beverage discussing merger with Constellation Brands, source says
summary: Energy drinks maker Monster Beverage Corp is reportedly discussing a merger with international beverage alcohol company Constellation Brands Inc. The potential deal involves companies with a combined market value of nearly $92-billion, although the structure of the deal is not yet known. Both companies have significant market capitalization, with Monster Beverage at $47.3-billion and Constellation Brands at $44.2-billion as of Friday.

title: Last Call: Ball Can Prices to Increase; Hawaii Stream Register 1.2% ABV
summary: Ball Corporation is significantly increasing can prices and minimum order quantities for craft brewers, with 12 oz. cans rising by nearly 28% and 16 oz. cans by 19.5%, leading to concerns within the Brewers Association about the impact on small brewers. This comes amidst a surge in can demand and supply chain issues. Additionally, the article reports on the death of Anthony Angotti, founder of Beers of the World, and a stream in Oahu, Hawaii registering 1.2% ABV due to contamination from a beverage warehouse spill.

title: Assessing the rise of RTD cocktails, decline of hard seltzer with CANTEEN Spirits CEO
summary: This article discusses the rise of ready-to-drink (RTD) cocktails coinciding with a decline in hard seltzer popularity, as observed by CANTEEN Spirits CEO, Brandon Cason. It highlights how RTD cocktails are driving significant growth in the off-premise spirits market due to consumer demand for convenient, low-ABV options, while hard seltzer sales are slowing after a period of rapid expansion. The piece emphasizes the increasing variety and projected continued growth of RTDs, with canned cocktails expected to exceed $2 billion in the US by 2022.

title: DoubleVerify acquires OpenSlate to strengthen CTV, social video targeting
summary: DoubleVerify has acquired OpenSlate, a contextual targeting platform for CTV and social video, in a cash and stock transaction valued at $150 million. This acquisition aims to provide marketers with an end-to-end solution for optimizing their advertising efforts by combining OpenSlate's pre-campaign tools with DoubleVerify's post-flight measurement suite. The deal highlights the growing demand for alternatives to third-party cookies and strengthens DoubleVerify's position in the rapidly expanding social video and CTV markets.

title: Bloomin' Brands and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers Team Up For A Hometown Partnership
summary: Bloomin' Brands, Inc. and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers announced a multi-year partnership, bringing together two Tampa Bay staples. This agreement includes marketing rights for Bloomin' Brands' portfolio of restaurants and features an Aussie Grill concession stand at Raymond James Stadium. To celebrate, Outback Steakhouse is offering exclusive Buccaneers souvenir tumblers at participating Tampa Bay locations.

title: Anti-Woke ETFs Are Pitching to Conservatives Mad at Corporate America
summary: 2ndVote Advisers, led by former JPMorgan Chase & Co. banker Dan Grant, is launching exchange-traded funds (ETFs) aimed at conservative investors who are displeased with companies taking liberal stances on social justice issues. Grant believes that the millions of Trump voters are ready to invest in companies that align with politically conservative values or remain neutral, pushing back against the trend of left-leaning socially conscious investing. This initiative attempts to blend politics and investing by catering to those who feel neglected by "woke" corporations.

title: MediaCom Becomes The Coca-Cola Company’s Global Media Agency As Part Of WPP’s OpenX Team
summary: WPP has been chosen as The Coca-Cola Company's Global Marketing Network Partner, with MediaCom serving as the global media agency for the bespoke OpenX team across most markets. This partnership, spanning over 200 markets, aims to transform Coca-Cola’s marketing effectiveness and efficiency starting January 1, 2022. The agreement highlights WPP's integrated capabilities across content, media, data, production, and technology.

title: Coca-Cola Europacific Partners makes US$15m switch to battery power at UK sites
summary: Coca-Cola Europacific Partners (CCEP) is investing US$15 million to switch to lithium-ion batteries for its equipment, such as forklift trucks, at its UK sites. This move is part of the company's broader goal to achieve net-zero carbon emissions. CCEP aims to reduce its carbon footprint and enhance sustainability in its operations.

title: WPP Named Global Marketing Network Partner for Coca-Cola
summary: WPP has been selected as the global marketing network partner for Coca-Cola, winning a significant pitch against rivals such as IPG, Dentsu, and Publicis Groupe. This appointment tasks WPP with driving growth for Coca-Cola's brand portfolio across over 200 countries and territories, as part of Coca-Cola's strategy to modernize its marketing and boost revenue. Coca-Cola's advertising spend was $2.78 billion in 2020, down from previous years.

title: WPP wins majority of $4 billion Coca-Cola business
summary: WPP has secured the majority of Coca-Cola's $4 billion global marketing business, creating a bespoke unit called OpenX to handle creative, media, data, and marketing technology. Dentsu will act as a complementary media partner in specific geographies like Japan and Korea, while Coca-Cola will also leverage an open-source creative model to tap diverse talent. This major win consolidates Coca-Cola's marketing efforts and represents a significant shift for the involved holding companies.

title: Coca-Cola names WPP global marketing partner
summary: Coca-Cola has appointed WPP as its global marketing network partner following a massive agency review that began in December 2020. A bespoke WPP team, OpenX, will manage end-to-end creative, media, data, and marketing technology across Coca-Cola's entire portfolio, while Dentsu was named a complementary media partner in select markets. This new integrated agency model aims to drive long-term growth and enhance marketing effectiveness and efficiency for the beverage giant.

title: Coca-Cola company names WPP as global marketing network partner
summary: WPP, the world's largest advertising company, has been named the global marketing network partner for The Coca-Cola Company, a significant win for WPP. This deal includes handling media in eight of Coca-Cola's nine operating units and the majority of its creative work. Coca-Cola also named Dentsu as a complementary media partner and will include Publicis Groupe and IPG in a strategic roster for an open-source creative model.

title: WPP wins Coca-Cola’s massive agency review
summary: WPP has won Coca-Cola's extensive agency review, securing a major account. The decision follows a competitive pitch process for one of the largest marketing accounts in the industry.

title: The Coca-Cola Company Names WPP as Global Marketing Network Partner; Also Appoints Complementary Media Partner
summary: The Coca-Cola Company has named WPP as its Global Marketing Network Partner to drive long-term growth across its brands in over 200 countries. This new integrated agency model aims to transform and modernize marketing and innovation, focusing on consumer-centric, data-driven experiences. Additionally, Dentsu has been appointed as a Complementary Media Partner in select markets, and a Strategic Roster of approved agencies will provide access to creative minds globally.

title: Splash Beverage Group’s TapouT Performance Drink Gets Rebrand: Enhanced Ergonomic Bottle & Clean Ingredients
summary: Splash Beverage Group is rebranding its TapouT performance hydration-recovery drink, set to launch in January 2022, to broaden its consumer appeal and secure larger distribution networks. The rebrand emphasizes clean ingredients like zero sugar and no artificial sweeteners, and features an ergonomic bottle and dual-language (English and Spanish) labeling. This strategic move aims to leverage the growing performance drink market, following the significant valuation seen in the Body Armor acquisition by Coca-Cola.

title: Meet The Markets: Introducing Germany
summary: Coca-Cola Europacific Partners (CCEP) introduces Germany as part of its "Meet the Markets" series, highlighting its long history, operations, and key figures in the country. The article details CCEP's product portfolio, customer reach, sustainability initiatives, and local community investments in Germany. It also shares interesting facts about Fanta and Mezzo Mix, both of which originated in Germany.

title: Coca-Cola Takes Full Ownership Of Bodyarmor For USD$5.6 Billion
summary: The Coca-Cola Company has acquired full ownership of sports drink company BodyArmor for USD$5.6 billion, following an initial 15% stake purchase in 2018. BodyArmor will operate as a separate business within Coca-Cola's U.S. operations, with its co-founder Mike Repole and president Brent Hastie remaining with the company. The acquisition marks Coca-Cola's largest brand purchase to date and comes as BodyArmor has surpassed Powerade in market share.

title: Coca-Cola to fully acquire Gatorade rival BodyArmor for $5.6 bln
summary: Coca-Cola announced it will acquire the remaining stake in BodyArmor for $5.6 billion, intensifying its competition with PepsiCo's Gatorade in the sports drink market. This acquisition is Coca-Cola's largest for a single brand and reflects a strategic shift to bolster its presence in the rapidly growing sports hydration category. BodyArmor, valued at $6.59 billion by the deal, currently boasts $1.4 billion in annual retail sales and a 50% growth rate.

title: Coca-Cola is buying sports drink maker BodyArmor
summary: Coca-Cola has acquired sports-drink maker BodyArmor for $5.6 billion, marking its largest brand acquisition to date. This move aims to challenge PepsiCo-owned Gatorade's market dominance and leverage BodyArmor's growing market share. Coca-Cola plans to use both Powerade and BodyArmor to compete more effectively in the expanding sports and performance drinks market.

title: The Coca-Cola Company Acquires Remaining Stake in BODYARMOR
summary: The Coca-Cola Company has acquired full ownership of BODYARMOR, a sports performance and hydration beverage line, for $5.6 billion in cash. This acquisition follows an initial 15% stake purchased in 2018. BODYARMOR will operate as a separate business within Coca-Cola’s North America unit, continuing its strong growth trajectory in the U.S. sports drink category.

title: Coca-Cola Co. offers optimistic outlook
summary: The Coca-Cola Co. reported a strong third quarter with net income rising 42% to $2.5 billion and sales up 16% to $10 billion, leading to an optimistic outlook and raised fiscal 2021 guidance. Despite challenges like uneven global recovery and commodity inflation, the company's chairman and CEO is confident in meeting the goal of emerging stronger from the pandemic. Management expects organic revenue growth of 13% to 14% and comparable EPS growth of 15% to 17% for 2021, and is proactively managing increased costs for 2022.

title: Coca-Cola nearly doubled its advertising this year
summary: Coca-Cola significantly increased its advertising budget this year, nearly doubling it from a year ago. Experts suggest this is a strategic move to maintain "top of mind" awareness among consumers, even for established brands, especially after cutting costs at the pandemic's outset. This advertising also helps combat inflation by allowing price increases while retaining loyal customers.

title: Coca-Cola Unveils 100% Plant-Based PET Bottle, Ready to Scale
summary: The Coca-Cola Company has introduced its first-ever beverage bottle made from 100% plant-based plastic, excluding the cap and label, utilizing two breakthrough technologies ready for commercial scaling. One technology uses sugar from corn to create plant-based terephthalic acid (bPTA), while the other, co-owned with Changchun Meihe Science & Technology, streamlines the production of plant-based monoethylene glycol (bMEG) from sugar sources. This innovation supports Coca-Cola's "World Without Waste" vision to reduce virgin plastic and move towards a circular economy.

title: Coca-Cola CEO expects to see sporadic product shortages through 2022
summary: Coca-Cola CEO James Quincey anticipates sporadic product shortages to continue through 2022 due to ongoing supply chain challenges and higher inflation. Despite these issues, Coke's earnings and revenue surpassed Wall Street estimates, leading to a 2% rise in share price and an updated fiscal 2021 forecast. Quincey likened the situation to an earthquake with diminishing aftershocks, acknowledging some persistent structural issues.

title: Kraft Heinz CEO: Miguel Patricio Biography
summary: This article provides a biography of Miguel Patricio, the CEO of Kraft Heinz, detailing his career progression from various global CPG companies, through his significant tenure at AB InBev where he focused on marketing and growing the Asia Pacific region, to his current role leading Kraft Heinz's transformation. It highlights his strategies for premiumization, marketing innovation, and fostering creativity to drive growth, along with recent financial performance and strategic asset divestitures under his leadership.

title: Pricier shipping containers and port delays haven't slowed Vita Coco's growth, co-CEO says
summary: Vita Coco, despite supply chain challenges and port delays, has continued to grow its business substantially, according to co-founder and co-CEO Mike Kirban. The company went public on Nasdaq under the symbol "COCO," raising $173 million with an initial offering price of $15 per share, although shares fell nearly 4% in afternoon trading. Vita Coco's strong long-term contracts with coconut manufacturers have helped it avoid higher commodity costs, a key differentiator from competitors.

title: Birmingham’s Coca-Cola Bottling Company United’s production team wins coveted President’s Award for Quality Excellence
summary: The New Orleans Coca-Cola Production Center, a facility of Birmingham's Coca-Cola Bottling Company United, Inc., has won the prestigious President's Award for Quality Excellence from The Coca-Cola Company. The facility was recognized for its best-in-class performance in reducing consumer complaints and its commitment to quality, even amidst challenges like Hurricane Ida. This achievement highlights the team's resilience and dedication to the company's core values.

title: The Coca-Cola Company Announces ESG Presentation for Investors
summary: The Coca-Cola Company announced an upcoming webcast for investors on November 3 at 11 a.m. ET to discuss its environmental, social, and governance (ESG) priorities. Bea Perez and Henrique Braun, along with other company leaders, will lead the discussion and a moderated Q&A session. Investors are invited to join the webcast and can review the company's latest Business & ESG Report in advance.

title: Coca-Cola Is Launching This for the First Time in Half a Decade
summary: Coca-Cola is launching a new brand campaign called "Real Magic," featuring a new logo and tagline, for the first time in five years. This rebrand comes amidst declining sales for Classic Coke and the discontinuation of underperforming brands as the company adapts to changing consumer preferences and addresses past criticisms. The campaign aims to connect with a younger, more health-conscious demographic that demands new approaches from the beverage giant.

title: The Coca-Cola Company unveils fresh brand platform for Coca-Cola trademark
summary: The Coca-Cola Company has launched a new global brand platform called "Real Magic" with a refreshed visual identity and logo. This platform aims to celebrate humanity and unite people, building on lessons from the past 18 months, and will be supported by a new campaign blending real and virtual worlds, featuring gamers and interactive elements. The initiative marks the first new global brand platform for Coca-Cola since 2016.

title: Coca-Cola thinks ‘outside the box,’ books bulk vessels to ship supplies
summary: Coca-Cola is utilizing bulk vessels to transport materials, a non-traditional approach to navigate limited vessel space and keep production lines running globally. This strategy, adopted by other retailers facing supply chain congestion, involves carrying over 60,000 tons of material to non-congested ports to avoid delays and high demurrage fees. While individual company actions may not shift market dynamics, this move highlights the significant impact and overstretched state of current logistics.

title: Press Clips: A-B Considers $1.2 Billion Sale of German Brands; Molson Coors Rolls Out Topo Chico Margarita Hard Seltzer Variety Pack
summary: Anheuser-Busch InBev is reportedly exploring a $1.2 billion sale of some of its German beer brands as it shifts focus to "beyond beer" products. Concurrently, Molson Coors is launching a Topo Chico Margarita Hard Seltzer variety pack and aims for a 10% share of the hard seltzer market by the end of 2021. The article also touches on a decline in hard seltzer purchasing contracts and new partnerships in the beverage industry.

title: Coca-Cola Global Brand Refresh Focuses on Consumer Experience
summary: Coca-Cola has launched a new 'Real Magic' brand platform, including a refreshed visual identity and global campaign, to celebrate humanity and create a movement towards a more human way of doing things. This marks the first update to its global platform for the Coke Trademark in five years and aims to significantly increase the consumer base through an ecosystem of experiences tied to consumption occasions and consumer passion points like gaming. The campaign features a new "Hug" logo and an integrated approach blending real and virtual worlds, exemplified by the "One Coke Away From Each Other" campaign that includes celebrity gamers and a code hunt for prizes.

title: The Coca-Cola Company Unveils New Global Brand Platform for Coca-Cola Trademark
summary: The Coca-Cola Company has launched a new global brand philosophy and platform called "Real Magic," refreshing its trademark promise to unite and uplift people. This platform, the first since 2016, introduces a refreshed visual identity, including the "Hug" logo, and launches with the "One Coke Away From Each Other" campaign, blending real and virtual worlds. The campaign involves collaborations with artists, gamers like DJ Alan Walker, and partners like Twitch, seeking to engage audiences through unique and ownable experiences.

title: id2021finalwebversion101.htm
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) held its 2021 Investor Day to highlight its transformation into a modern beverage company, emphasizing its strong financial model, sustainable growth, and significant M&A capacity. The company aims for mid-single digit net sales growth and high-single digit adjusted EPS growth in the long term, supported by industry-leading cash conversion and a scalable business model. KDP also detailed its strong ESG commitments, robust go-to-market strategy, and an expanded capital allocation plan that now includes inorganic options like share buybacks.

title: Where AB-InBev, Molson Coors, Diageo rank in the Corporate Plastic Pollution Scorecard
summary: As You Sow released its "Corporate Plastic Pollution Scorecard 2021," evaluating 50 major U.S. consumer companies on their efforts to reduce plastic pollution. The report highlights progress in virgin plastic reduction commitments but notes that no companies have sufficiently robust policies given the urgency of the crisis. Coca-Cola received the highest grade with transparency and strong recycling commitments, while adult beverage companies like Diageo, Molson Coors, and AB InBev received lower scores, indicating significant room for improvement, particularly in recycling support and packaging design.

title: Embotelladoras de Coca-Cola en Chile distribuirán bebidas alcohólicas
summary: Coca-Cola Embonor and Embotelladora Andina have signed a distribution agreement with Viña Santa Rita to sell and distribute wines, sparkling wines, and wine cocktails in Chile. This move is part of Coca-Cola Embonor's diversification strategy to include alcoholic beverages, with an anticipated increase in sales of 28 million liters, equivalent to $32.3 million. The agreement is also expected to enhance their competitiveness against Compañía Cerveceras Unidas (CCU) in the Chilean market.

title: The Coca-Cola Company Unveils New Global Brand Platform for Coca-Cola Trademark
summary: The Coca-Cola Company has launched "Real Magic," a new global brand philosophy and platform, refreshing its trademark promise to unite and uplift people. This marks the first new global platform since 2016 and introduces a refreshed visual identity, including the "Hug" logo. The platform kicks off with the "One Coke Away From Each Other" campaign, blending real and virtual worlds and featuring collaborations with gamers and artists.

title: Rethinking Sustainable Packaging and Innovation in the Beverage Industry
summary: This article discusses the Coca-Cola Company's sustainable packaging initiative, "World Without Waste," and its efforts to reduce plastic waste in the beverage industry. Raoni Lotar, Frontline Marketing Director, details goals to make packaging 100% recyclable by 2025 and use 50% recycled material by 2030, alongside efforts in collection and partnerships. The company highlights innovations like label-less bottles and the importance of collaborative events like ReThink in achieving sustainability targets.

title: Ball Corp. plans $290M factory investment amid increasing can demand
summary: Ball Corp. announced a $290 million investment in a new beverage can factory, driven by booming demand for aluminum cans. This move is part of the company's continuous expansion efforts over the past year, establishing new manufacturing locations to meet market needs.

title: Danone’s Evian partners with Loop on water bottle made with recycled plastic
summary: Danone's Evian brand is rolling out a new prototype water bottle made from 100% recycled PET using technology from Loop Industries. This initiative is a major step towards Evian's goal of using all recycled plastic in its bottles by 2025 and aims to repurpose PET waste that would otherwise be discarded. The technology allows diverse plastic waste to be transformed into food-grade plastic, with commercial rollout starting in South Korea in 2022.

title: Noticia CCB | Ruta tenderos: Formación a 1.000 pequeños comerciantes en Bogotá para fortalecer sus negocios
summary: The Coca-Cola System and the Bogotá Chamber of Commerce have launched "Ruta Tenderos," an initiative to strengthen traditional small shops in Bogotá. The project will provide training and digital integration support to 1,000 small business owners, focusing on areas like accounting, customer service, inventory management, and electronic payments. This effort aims to foster economic and social sustainability by helping these businesses innovate and contribute to the country's economic reactivation post-pandemic.

title: Coca-Cola takes flexible approach to navigate COVID-19
summary: The Coca-Cola Co. is adopting a flexible and adaptive strategy to navigate the ongoing impacts of COVID-19, leveraging its strong brands and balance sheet. This approach involves scaling operations selectively in regional markets and aligning marketing agendas with local conditions, while also streamlining internal functions for greater agility. The company is focusing on maintaining relevance to consumers and customers globally by balancing scale with intimacy in local markets.

title: PNC Announces Amanda Rosseter As Chief Communications Officer
summary: PNC Financial Services Group, Inc. announced Amanda Rosseter has joined the company as chief communications officer, bringing nearly three decades of experience from roles at Equifax and The Coca-Cola Company. In her new role, Rosseter will lead strategic external and internal communications, overseeing media relations, corporate responsibility, and executive communications, as PNC executes its national expansion strategy. Kristen Baird Adams, who previously served as interim chief communications officer, will return as chief of staff to PNC's Office of Regional Presidents.

title: Top 100 Food and Beverage Company Highlights: #8 The Coca-Cola Company
summary: The Coca-Cola Company saw significant net revenue acceleration by 42% in Q2, driven by pandemic recovery, posting $10.1 billion with 26% growth in concentrate sales. The company is undergoing a global restructuring effort, including job cuts and streamlined operations into nine units and five global categories. Recent activities include the sale of US production facilities, intent to acquire Bodyarmor, increased takeover offers for Coca-Cola Amatil, and investments in cultured milk products, alongside product launches and discontinuation.

title: Embotelladoras de Coca-Cola en Chile suscriben contrato para distribuir marcas de Viña Santa Rita
summary: Coca-Cola Embonor S.A., its subsidiary Embotelladora Iquique S.A., and Embotelladora Andina S.A. have signed a five-year distribution agreement with Viña Santa Rita in Chile. This contract, effective November 2nd, will cover the sale, commercialization, and distribution of Viña Santa Rita's wines, sparkling wines, and wine cocktails, including brands like Casa Real, Medalla Real, Carmen, Santa Rita, 120, and Terra Andina. The agreement strengthens Coca-Cola Embonor's alcohol beverage portfolio and enhances Viña Santa Rita's market access and product availability.

title: Keurig Dr Pepper launches Pepper Perks loyalty program
summary: Keurig Dr Pepper launched the Pepper Perks loyalty program for its Dr Pepper brand, allowing fans to earn points by scanning receipts of purchases for rewards like limited-edition flavors and merchandise. This initiative aims to strengthen brand loyalty and provides an opportunity to test new flavors, following similar successful strategies by competitors like Coca-Cola and Pepsi. The move capitalizes on the growing preference for loyalty programs among consumers and the soda category's young core customer base.

title: PepsiCo Announces "Net Water Positive" Commitment
summary: PepsiCo has announced its ambition to become "Net Water Positive" by 2030, aiming to replenish more water than it uses, particularly in high-risk watersheds. This commitment includes reducing water usage in its operations and expanding The PepsiCo Foundation's safe water access program with a $1 million investment in Sub-Saharan Africa. The initiative, in partnership with WaterAid, seeks to provide safe water to 100 million people by 2030 and addresses critical needs exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Procter & Gamble regains its title as top global advertiser
summary: Procter & Gamble has reclaimed its position as the world's top advertiser, surpassing Amazon, with a marketing expenditure of $11.5 billion in its last fiscal year. This resurgence highlights the CPG giant's strategy of maintaining ad spending even during difficult economic times, a move that brand consultants argue has consistently benefited the company. While Amazon has the capacity to increase its ad spending significantly, P&G's continued investment in marketing has proven effective in sustaining its brand presence and sales growth.

title: Coca Cola HBC seals Egypt deal after first-half profit jump
summary: Coca Cola HBC agreed to acquire a majority stake in Coca-Cola Bottling Company of Egypt for $427 million following a significant rise in its first-half comparable operating profit. Despite expecting lower operating profit margins in the second half of the year due to rising cost inflation, the company anticipates overall annual margin expansion. Analysts, however, expressed concerns about upside risk to FY22 margin expectations given continued high raw material costs.

title: Aluminum can shortage holds back Monster
summary: Monster Beverage Corp. experienced a decrease in net income during the third quarter of 2021, reporting $337.21 million, down 3.1% from the previous year, despite a 13% increase in net sales to $1.41 billion. The company attributed these financial results primarily to an ongoing aluminum can shortage, compounded by freight inefficiencies, shipping container shortages, and port congestion. Monster also noted a favorable impact from foreign currency exchange rates on its net sales and successfully launched its True North Pure Energy Seltzer line.

title: Coca-Cola closing pair of bottling plants affecting nearly 500 workers
summary: Coca-Cola plans to close two bottling plants in California and Massachusetts by 2023, impacting nearly 500 workers. These closures are part of the company's "asset right" strategy to streamline operations and focus on growing brands as consumer tastes evolve, building on earlier efforts to cut jobs and divest underperforming brands. The move highlights Coca-Cola's ongoing restructuring amidst evolving consumer habits and a broader labor shortage.

title: Coca-Cola to close Massachusetts bottling plant in 2023, leaving hundreds jobless
summary: Coca-Cola announced its plans to close a Massachusetts bottling plant in Northampton by summer 2023, impacting 319 employees. This closure is part of a larger corporate restructuring and will result in a significant economic loss for the city, as the plant is its largest manufacturer, water customer, and taxpayer, contributing $306,000 in annual property taxes. The company also plans to sell facilities in Michigan, Missouri, and Texas.

title: Inflation is ‘bad for America,’ says Scotts Miracle-Gro CEO
summary: Scotts Miracle-Gro CEO Jim Hagedorn voiced strong frustration over inflation, calling it "bad for America" and highlighting that some commodity pricing is "irresponsible" as companies raise prices simply "because they can." The company's shares dropped to a nine-month low despite beating earnings expectations, as inflationary pressures are expected to negatively impact future profits. Hagedorn warned that these cost pressures, which feel "unrelenting," are detrimental not only to profit margins but also to the broader economy.

title: Refresco to acquire three production facilities in the US from The Coca-Cola Company
summary: Refresco, the world's largest independent bottler, announced an agreement to acquire three production facilities in the United States from The Coca-Cola Company. This acquisition is subject to regulatory approval and will expand Refresco's manufacturing footprint and technological capabilities in North America. Refresco will also enter into long-term agreements for contract manufacturing activities with Coca-Cola.

title: PepsiCo to sell Tropicana, other juice brands for $3.3B
summary: PepsiCo is selling its Tropicana, Naked, and other juice brands in North America and Europe to private-equity firm PAI Partners for $3.3 billion in pre-tax proceeds. PepsiCo will retain a 39% noncontrolling stake and exclusive distribution rights for chilled direct store delivery. This divestment aims to strengthen PepsiCo's balance sheet and allow it to focus on its core businesses, healthier snacks, and zero-calorie beverages amidst declining juice sales over recent years.

title: PepsiCo exiting juice business
summary: PepsiCo is selling a majority stake in its Tropicana, Naked, and other juice businesses to private equity firm PAI Partners for approximately $3.3 billion, retaining a 39% ownership in a joint venture. This divestment allows PepsiCo to focus on healthier snacks, zero-calorie beverages, and products like SodaStream, aligning with a broader industry trend of major beverage companies streamlining portfolios. The sale also reflects the long-term decline in fruit juice consumption and the evolving role of juice in consumer diets.

title: PepsiCo to sell Tropicana, other juice brands for $3.3 billion
summary: PepsiCo announced the sale of its Tropicana and other North American juice brands to French private equity firm PAI Partners for $3.3 billion. The move aims to simplify PepsiCo's product range, reduce focus on high-sugar drinks, and provide funds for investment in health-focused snacks and zero-calorie beverages. PepsiCo will retain a 39% stake in the new joint venture and exclusive U.S. distribution rights for the brands.

title: José Said Saffie: De los textiles a la banca, a la Coca Cola y a los negocios inmobiliarios
summary: This article details the vast and varied business empire of José Said Saffie, tracing his family's origin from textile manufacturing to their current dominance in banking, beverage bottling (Coca-Cola), and real estate through companies like Embotelladora Andina and Parque Arauco. It highlights the Said group's expansion into Latin America, particularly Argentina, and their strategic alliances and investments over several decades, including their involvement with BBVA-BHIF. The article also touches upon the family's historical trajectory, navigating political changes in Chile and adapting their business model to achieve significant financial success.

title: UNFI Announces Appointments of Sandy Douglas as Chief Executive Officer and Jack Stahl as Independent Chair of the Board
summary: United Natural Foods, Inc. (UNFI) announced the appointment of J. Alexander (Sandy) Miller Douglas as its new Chief Executive Officer and a member of its Board of Directors, effective August 9, 2021. Douglas, formerly CEO of Staples, Inc. and President of Coca-Cola North America, succeeds Steven Spinner. Concurrently, Jack Stahl was elected as the Independent Chair of the Board, also effective August 9, 2021.
source: United Natural Foods, Inc. - Investor Relations
source_domain: United Natural Foods, Inc. - Investor Relations
